en.wiki\n==Anteil der erwerbslosen Personen:
wiki == proportion of unemployed persons in private households in the labor force in households (employed and unemployed) of working age (15 years) (unemployment rate) == === statement === The indicator shows from an economic point of view, the relative underutilization of the production factor Job. It provides information about the relationship of people with no employment available to the labor force and looking for work, overall the labor force (employed and unemployed).
  === indicator calculation === For the calculation of the indicator unemployment rate on May 9 at the closing in 2011, the number of unemployed persons in private households aged 15 years by the number of employed persons in private households (employed and unemployed) of working age (from 15 years) and multiply by 100.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data of the performed 9 May 2011 register-based census.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'population' ''
  For the population, the population, the 9th at the closing in May 2011 include their primary residence in the municipality had. Not to the population are foreign nationals working of the Army, the police and the Foreign Service and their families living there.
  * '' 'Household' ''
  As a household budget is referred to, which consists only of those have their own financial management. A household consists of at least one person. All persons regardless of their residential status (primary / secondary residence) live together in an apartment, are considered to be members of the same household, such that there is one household per occupied dwelling. People in community or institutional households are not included here. A person of private household is defined as a caregiver. On the basis of that person's household type and the position of other people who are authorized within the home.
  *'''Age'''
  The age of the person refers to the completed year of age to date 9 May 2011.
  * '' 'Unemployed' ''
  As unemployed every person of working age over 15, the (9 to 15 May 2011) in a one-week period was not working, but has actively sought in the last four weeks preceding the survey for a job. The temporal extent of the work sought is irrelevant. A new work has to be taken within two weeks. The inclusion of an employment agency or a local carrier in the search effort is required.
  * '' 'Gainfully employed' ''
  Employment according to the ILO definition, any person of working age between 15 and 74 years who has worked in a one-week period at least one hour for pay or as part of a self-employed or a family worker. Even someone who is in a formal working relationship that he has only temporarily absent during the reporting period, considered employed.
  * '' 'Labor' ''
  The number of employed persons arises from the sum of the employed and the unemployed.
  === === Further information [https://ergebnisse.zensus2011.de/|Auswertungsdatenbank]
  [Https://www.regionalstatistik.de/genesis/online?operation=s tatistikenVerzeichnis | regional database: Areas]
en.wiki\n==Anteil der Erwerbst\u00e4tigen i:
wiki == proportion of workers aged from 15 to 64 years in private households in the population of the same age in private households (employment rate) == === statement === The indicator provides information on the labor force participation of the population in private households.
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator Employment rate of the closing date 9 May 2011, the number of employed persons aged 15 years in private households divided by the population of the same age in private households and multiplying by 100.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data of the performed 9 May 2011 register-based census.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'population' ''
  For the population, the population, the 9th at the closing in May 2011 include their primary residence in the municipality had. Not to the population are foreign nationals working of the Army, the police and the Foreign Service and their families living there.
  * '' 'Household' ''
  As a household budget is referred to, which consists only of those have their own financial management. A household consists of at least one person. All persons regardless of their residential status (primary / secondary residence) live together in an apartment, are considered to be members of the same household, such that there is one household per occupied dwelling. People in community or institutional households are not included here. A person of private household is defined as a caregiver. On the basis of that person's household type and the position of other people who are authorized within the home.
  *'''Age'''
  The age of the person refers to the completed year of age to date 9 May 2011.
  * '' 'Gainfully employed' ''
  Employment according to the ILO definition, any person of working age from 15 years, (9 to 15 May 2011) in a one-week period at least one hour worked long on a fee or as part of a self-employed or a family worker. Even someone who is in a formal working relationship that he has only temporarily absent during the reporting period, considered employed.
  === === Further information [https://ergebnisse.zensus2011.de/|Auswertungsdatenbank]
  [Https://www.regionalstatistik.de/genesis/online?operation=s tatistikenVerzeichnis | regional database: Areas]
en.wiki\n==Anteil der weiblichen Erwerbst\u:
wiki == proportion of female workers aged 15 years in private households in the female population of the same age in private households (employment rate of women) == === statement === This indicator provides information on the proportion of employed women aged 15 years in private households in the female population of the same age in private households and so gives insight into the participation of women in the labor market.
  === indicator calculation === For the calculation of the indicator employment rate for women 9 to date May 2011, the number of female employed persons aged 15 years in private households is divided by the female population of the same age in private households and multiplying by 100.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data of the performed 9 May 2011 register-based census.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'population' ''

All persons regardless of their residential status (primary / secondary residence) live together in an apartment, are considered to be members of the same household, such that there is one household per occupied dwelling. People in community or institutional households are not included here. A person of private household is defined as a caregiver. On the basis of that person's household type and the position of other people who are authorized within the home.
  *'''Age'''
  The age of the person refers to the completed year of age to date 9 May 2011.
  * '' 'Gainfully employed' ''
  Employment according to the ILO definition, any person of working age from 15 years, (9 to 15 May 2011) in a one-week period at least one hour worked long on a fee or as part of a self-employed or a family worker. Even someone who is in a formal working relationship that he has only temporarily absent during the reporting period, considered employed.

en.wiki\n==Durchschnittliche Anzahl der Per:
wiki == Average number of persons per private household == === === statement indicator provides information about the number of persons living in a household on average. It is evidence of settlement structural differences in the coexistence of the population.
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator Average number of persons per private household 9 at the closing in May 2011, the number of all persons living in private households divided by the total number of households.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data of the performed 9 May 2011 register-based census.
  === === feature descriptions * '' 'households' '' as a household is referred to a household consisting only of those having its own financial management. A household consists of at least one person. All persons regardless of their residential status (primary / secondary residence) live together in an apartment, are considered to be members of the same household, such that there is one household per occupied dwelling. People in community or institutional households are not included here. A person of private household is defined as a caregiver. On the basis of that person's household type and the position of other people who are authorized within the home.
  * '' 'Household size' ''
  This feature indicates the number of persons living in a private household.
  === === Further information [https://ergebnisse.zensus2011.de/|Auswertungsdatenbank]

en.wiki\n==Anteil der Einpersonenhaushalte:
wiki == proportion of single-person households in the private households in total == === === statement The indicator shows the proportion of single-person households to households to total. Particularly for housing policy and spatial planning decisions of a region presents this indicator is an important basis for planning.
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator proportion of single-person households in the private households in total to date 9 May 2011, the number of single-person households as a whole is divided by the number of households and multiplying by 100.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data of the performed 9 May 2011 register-based census.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'household' ''
  As a household budget is referred to, which consists only of those have their own financial management. A household consists of at least one person. All persons regardless of their residential status (primary / secondary residence) live together in an apartment, are considered to be members of the same household, such that there is one household per occupied dwelling. People in community or institutional households are not included here. A person of private household is defined as a caregiver. On the basis of that person's household type and the position of other people who are authorized within the home.
  *'''One person household'''
  A one-person household means a household with a person living alone.
  === === Further information [https://ergebnisse.zensus2011.de/|Auswertungsdatenbank]

en.wiki\n==Anteil der Privathaushalte mit K:
wiki == proportion of households with children in private households in total == === === statement indicator provides information on the proportion of Privataushalten with children and thus way of living together in society.
  === indicator calculation === For the calculation of the indicator percentage of households with children in private households in total to date 9 May 2011 dividing the number of households with at least one child by the number of all private households and multiplying by 100. The denominator only Privataushalte of couples with children and single parents are included. Not take into account multi-person households are without nuclear family in which children live, for example, Grandparents grandchild households without parents.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data of the performed 9 May 2011 register-based census.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'household' ''
  As a household budget is referred to, which consists only of those have their own financial management. A household consists of at least one person. All persons regardless of their residential status (primary / secondary residence) live together in an apartment, are considered to be members of the same household, such that there is one household per occupied dwelling. People in community or institutional households are not included here. A person of private household is defined as a caregiver. On the basis of that person's household type and the position of other people who are authorized within the home.
  *'''Children)'''
  Under child is to understand (regardless of age) a biological son or a step or adopted son or a biological daughter or a step or adopted daughter, its or their usually resident in private households at least one parent and the parent (s) the household type determines / s.
  '(Ren) Households with child' * '' ''
  Among the households with children couples are counted with children and single parents. The term pairs includes pairs in a marriage, a registered partnership and a cohabiting who live together in each case in a private home. A single mother or a single father is a parent without a partner with at least one child in a private household. Not take into account multi-person households are without nuclear family in which children live, for example, Grandparents grandchild households without parents.

It provides information on the overall labor productivity. The scope of work (working volume) is not covered by this indicator. wiki == change in gross domestic product at current prices the previous year == === === statement The change in gross domestic product (GDP) compared to last year puts the development of the economic performance of an economy over time. It provides information on how the total value of goods and services produced has changed compared to last year. GDP is the key indicator of growth, cyclical and structural observation. In assessing the goods and services at current prices (nominal) prices of each reporting year are used. The indicator is not to be confused with the price-adjusted GDP chained, whose rate of change usually serves as a measure for the economic development of economies.
  === indicator calculation === For the calculation of the indicator "variation of the gross domestic product at current prices to last year", the value of the gross domestic product divided at current prices in the reporting period by the value of the gross domestic product at current prices of the previous year, multiplied by 100, and finally 100 subtracted.

en.wiki\n==Anteil der m\u00e4nnlichen Arbei:
wiki == percentage of male unemployment in the male civilian labor force averaged over the year == === === statement indicator provides information on how high the proportion of registered with the Federal Employment Agency unemployed men is based on all male civilian labor force.
  === === indicator calculation unemployment, the relative under-utilization of labor supply indicate by setting the (registered) unemployed to the labor force (= labor force employed + unemployed) in relationship. Here, from 2009 all civilian employees (s. U.) Is used. For the calculation of the indicator "proportion of male unemployed in the male civilian population in the annual average", that is, the unemployment rate in men, the number of male unemployment is divided by the number of male civilian population and multiplying by 100.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data on unemployment and employment, which are included in the employment statistics of employment services and agencies of the Federal Employment Agency.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'unemployed' ''
  Those temporarily non-proportional employment are in or to work only less than 15 hours per week full employment, a policyholder-included mandatory, looking for at least 15 hours per week full employment, are the mediation efforts of the employment agency or the job center available so are allowed to work are able to work and -ready, in the Federal Republic of Germany Land, are not younger than 15 years and have not yet reached the age limit for retirement, have registered in person at an employment agency or job center as unemployed. For need of assistance under SGB II 1 SGB II is in accordance with § 53a para. Unemployment definition of § 16 SGB III apply mutatis mutandis. For the calculation of the indicator "proportion of male unemployed in the male civilian population in the annual average", that is, the unemployment rate in men who annual average number of male unemployment is used (the residence).
  * '' 'Labor' ''
  The circle of the labor force (labor force = employed + unemployed) can be defined in different ways. - All civilian labor force: This includes not only the unemployed all civilian employment to which the dependent civilian labor force and include the self-employed and family workers (s u..). - dependent civilian labor force: This includes not only the unemployed, the dependent civilian labor force, including the full social security contributions (including apprentices.), Marginally employed, persons in employment opportunities (extra cost option), officials (excluding soldiers) and cross-border commuters are. Self-employed and their family workers are not counted.
  Source: Statistics of the Federal Employment Agency (BA)

  all persons who are not German within the meaning of Article 116 para. 1 GG apply are under the Aliens Act as a foreigner. This includes stateless persons and persons with unexplained or unknown nationality. Those both the German and have another nationality, are considered as German nationals. Homeless foreigners are statistically treated as German. The terms foreigners and non-German are used interchangeably in some publications.
 
  Source: Statistics of the Federal Employment Agency (BA)

en.wiki\n==Anteil der M\u00e4nner an den Pe:
wiki == proportion of men to the persons with parental benefit cover for Born in children == === === statement indicator provides information on the participation of fathers on parental benefits. It shows the participation of fathers in parental leave and provides information on: - the current situation, or changes in work and family orientation of young fathers - the break-up of role models / gender stereotypes; social and operational acceptance of the new fathers.
  === indicator calculation === For the calculation of the indicator proportion of men to the persons with parental benefit cover for Born in children, the number of fathers is divided with After parents money terms by the total number of persons with After parental allowance terms and multiplied by 100.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data from the federal statistics on parental benefits.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'parental allowance' ''
  The parental allowance is a transfer payment of the state for families with young children to support in securing their livelihood, which is designed as a benefit in lieu of power in the first place. The parental benefit payment will go beyond the period of maternity leave. The law on parental allowance and parental leave (BEEG), which applies to born from January 1, 2007 Children, put the parents money to the site of the former child-raising allowance. There is no permanent support. The payment of parental benefit is basically limited to twelve months immediately after birth of the child. the right to a total of 14 months over two months partners can be expanded. For single parents who hold sole custody or at least sole residence determination, are entitled to fourteen months parental allowance (§ 4 para. 3 BEEG). The amount of parental benefit is based on the net income of the parent who files the application for parental benefits, serving as a temporary replacement fee. Non-employed persons receive parental benefits in the minimum amount as a social benefit.
  * '' 'Parental leave' ''
  As parental leave in Germany a period of unpaid time off is called from work after the birth of a child. This exemption have salaried (ie not independent) Parents have a legal right. The Bundeselterngeld- and parental leave law grants mothers and fathers up to the age of three have their child a legal right to parental leave. Both parents are in this case considered separately, so both parents can be wholly or partly go along on parental leave. Conditions for the legal claim is that the parents raise the child himself after and and live with the child in a common household. Furthermore, the resident or has to be the habitual residence of the parents in the Federal Republic of Germany and must not be pursued employment during parental leave in excess of a working week of 30 hours. In addition to workers who after Bundeselterngeld- and parental leave law also trainees and employees working at home a legal right to parental leave (§ 20 BEEG).
  === === Further information [https://www.destatis.de/DE/Methoden/Qualitaet/Qualitaetsber eights / social / elterngeld.pdf | parental benefits]

wiki == of care per 1,000 population aged 65 years and older == === === statement indicator provides information on the use of approved maintenance services of persons aged 65 years and older.
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator 'of care per 1,000 population aged 65 years and above' is the number of people needing care at 12.15. and 31.12. of the year as the number of residents aged 65 years and above at 31.12. of the year divided and multiplied by 1,000.
  === === origin Statistics The indicator is based on data of the statistic about the recipients of care benefits, the statistics on ambulatory care facilities (nursing services) and statistics on inpatient care facilities (nursing homes) and from the population statistics.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'of care' ''
  According to Care Insurance Act such persons are considered to be in need of care, which likely need for at least 6 months of help because of a physical or mental illness or disability in the long run. only those who are in the survey included obtained either care benefit or be ambulatory of a nursing service or stationary supplied in a nursing home and benefits in accordance with the SGB XI. The decisive factor is the decision of the nursing care insurance or private insurance company of the occurrence of long-term care and the assignment of the patient to the care stages I to III (including hardness cases). the care are included in the survey deviation from this, in stationary applications, which were taken directly to the nursing facility following a hospital stay and receive benefits under SGB XI, but no association exists for a certain level of care. Since often only occurs in these cases, the allocation of the care level retroactively, this group of people is taken into account at the survey date with. In the number of people needing care duplicate entries can be included, if the receiver inside receive / by-care nursing additionally outpatient care or care allowance.
  * '' 'Residents' ''
  To the inhabitants of Germany all people are (German and foreign) who have their permanent residence in Germany. but not to the inhabitants include the members of foreign missions and forces. For the calculation of the indicator 'of care per 1,000 population aged 65 years and older YYYY' is the number of residents aged 65 years and above at 31.12. of the year used. If this is not yet available for the last reporting period, the population of the previous year is used. The population figures are from the statistical bureaus of the federal and state governments and are based in the former West Germany until 2010 on the results of the census of 25 May 1987. In the new federal states on 3 October 1990 established official population is the foundation. As of the 2011 reporting year, the results are presented on the basis of carried out on May 9, 2011 census.

wiki == population density. inhabitants per square kilometer at 31.12 == === === statement The population density sheds light on the relationship of citizens to the district area. The population density is the most common density measure for distinguishing between urban and rural areas. The significance of the indicator is limited by the fact that the population is not evenly distributed over an area (z. B. are not, or only slightly populated forest and agricultural land).
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator "inhabitants per square kilometer at 31.12." the number of population is divided by the area of ​​surface. Hence the population density of a regional unit.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data from the "Statistics of updating the population object" and the "determination of the area object."

BMG of 3 May 2013 (Federal Law Gazette I p 1084), as amended established by Article 2 law of 11 October 2016 (Federal law Gazette I, p. 2218)). Not the population, however, the members of the armed forces stationed in and the foreign diplomatic and consular missions, with their family members.

en.wiki\n==Bev\u00f6lkerungszunahme (+) bzw:
wiki == population increase (+) or population decrease (-) per 10,000 population == === === statement indicator provides information about the relative Bevölkerungszu- or decrease per year. The population change is made up of natural population growth, net migration and inventory corrections. Positive values ​​indicate that population growth, negative values ​​for a population decline.
  === indicator calculation === For the calculation of the indicator "population increase (+) or decrease in population (-) per 10,000 population" is the difference formed between the population of each reporting period minus the population of the previous year, by the total population (average annual population) divided and multiplied by 10,000. For the calculation of the annual average population is used. By 2010, the average annual population is the arithmetic average of the twelve monthly averages. These are calculated in each case as the arithmetic mean from the beginning and ending of the relevant month. The average population in 2011 is the date population on 9 May 2011. From 2012, the average annual population mean the average of beginning and year end of year.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data from the "Statistics of updating the population stocks."
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'population' ''
  The population of a municipality since the early 80s includes all persons in this community their sole or main residence have ((§ 21f Federal Registration Act -. BMG of 3 May 2013 (Federal Law Gazette I p 1084), as amended established by Article 2 law of 11 October 2016 (Federal law Gazette I, p. 2218)). Previously, the population was at the place of sole or predominantly used apartment acquired (resident population). the annual update of the population is performed using the results of the statistics of natural population change over the births and deaths, marriages, divorces, be-ups and cancellation of civil partnerships, the migration statistics on entries and exits, as well as inventory adjustments due to subsequently filed reports of Standes- and registration offices. the population data from the reference year 2011 are to update numbers based on the results of the census, 09 May 2011th the B evölkerungsdaten from 31 December 1987 to 2010 are created in the former West Germany due to the census of 25 May 1987, in the former East Germany which established on 3 October 1990 due to an extract of the central population register of the former GDR official population forms the basis , The population count also reported in the Federal Territory foreigners (including stateless persons and those seeking protection). Not the population, however, the members of the armed forces stationed in and the foreign diplomatic and consular missions, with their family members.
  === === Regional characteristics * Average annual population
  Baden-Wuerttemberg (until 2000), Bavaria, Hesse, North Rhine-Westphalia, Lower Saxony, Rhineland-Palatinate, Saarland (until 1999), Saxony (until 2007): the arithmetic mean of the population at the beginning and end of year
 
  For the years 1995, 2000 and 2005, the indicator may "Population Increase (+) or population decrease (-) per 10,000 population" due to the lack of prior year figures are not shown. For 2011, the indicator can not be expelled because the comparison of population equivalents at the end of the year 2010, based on the census of 25 May 1987 and based on the register data of 3 October 1990 with the population equivalents at the end of the year 2011 does not make sense based on the census of 9 May 2011th

wiki == deaths per 10,000 population == === === statement indicator provides information about how many deaths per 10,000 people per year. He is also called the general mortality rate.

wiki == birth surplus (+) or Died income (-) per 10,000 population == === === The statement birth balance the natural population movement represents. Positive indicator values ​​come into effect when the number of births is higher than the number of deaths. In this case, a natural population growth is taking place, that is, the population is growing, not a negative net migration provided the birth surplus balances
  === indicator calculation === For the calculation of the indicator "birth surplus (+) or Died excess () per 10,000 population" the balance between births and deaths is formed by the total population (average annual population) divided and multiplied by 10,000. For the calculation of the annual average population is used. By 2010, the average annual population is the arithmetic average of the twelve monthly averages. These are calculated in each case as the arithmetic mean from the beginning and ending of the relevant month. The average population in 2011 is the date population on 9 May 2011. en.wiki\n==Krankenhausbettendichte je 1.000:
wiki == hospital bed per 1,000 population density == === === statement The indicator shows how many hospital beds as an annual average per 1,000 inhabitants were set up and is also known as bed density. It is a measure of inpatient health care. In the interpretation of the indicator should be noted that a high bed density may also be caused by over regional centers aligned (e.g., university hospitals).
  === === indicators calculation for the calculation of the indicator 'hospital bed per 1,000 population density' the sum of the average of available beds is divided by the average population and multiplied by 1,000.
  === === origin Statistics The indicator is based on data from the data I Basic hospital statistics, in some cases where they are added to the hospital directory. in the hospital directory as only information received from hospitals that have agreed to a recording writing, based on it evaluations of other published results may vary. The survey is conducted annually.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'hospitals' ''
  Hospitals in the purpose of this survey is a plant, one of the Social Code Book V (SGB V) in accordance with § 107 serve the hospital and obstetrics, -. Technical-medical are under constant medical supervision, possess sufficient relevant to their public service mission diagnostic and therapeutic facilities of the patients disease symptoms with the help of available-available medical care, functional and medical-technical staff are equipped to handle primarily by medical and nursing assistance diseases to identify, cure, prevent it from deteriorating to - and work according to recognized scientific methods, to afford alleviate or obstetrics, and in which patients can be housed and fed. Proof is without Bundeswehr hospitals.
  * '' '-Installed beds' ''
  All the beds, which are set up ready for use at the facility, regardless of the funding. The bedding is expressed as an annual average. In general, the annual average yields averaged existing on the month ends beds.
  * '' 'Residents' ''
  To the inhabitants of Germany all people are (German and foreign) who have their permanent residence in Germany. but not to the inhabitants include the members of foreign missions and forces. The indicator 'hospital beds per 1,000 population' corresponds to the population of the average annual population. By 2010, the average annual population is the arithmetic average of the twelve monthly averages. These are calculated in each case as the arithmetic mean from the beginning and ending of the relevant month. The average population in 2011 is the date population on 9 May 2011. From 2012 calculated the average annual population for the simple arithmetic average of the beginning and ending of the respective reporting period.
  === === Regional characteristics * Average annual population
  Baden-Wuerttemberg (1995, 2000), Bavaria, Hesse, North Rhine-Westphalia, Lower Saxony, Rhineland-Palatinate, Saarland (until 1999), Saxony (until 2007) the arithmetic mean of the population at the beginning and end of the year.
  * Saxony-Anhalt (until 2006)
  As a result of the district reform on 1 July 2007 is that from 31.12 instead of the average annual population. of the year used.
  * Rhineland-Palatinate (2012)
  The average annual population is the arithmetic average of the twelve monthly averages.
  * Bavaria, Schleswig-Holstein (1995)
  Incl. Bundeswehr hospitals.
  * Bayern (2005)
  Incl. Beds for healthy newborns.
  *Bremen
  Incl. a pure day clinic with 10 day-care centers in Bremerhaven.
  * Baden-Wuerttemberg (2002, 2003), Hesse (2003, 2006, 2007)
  No county results available.
  * North Rhine-Westphalia (until 2003)
  General hospitals.
  * Rhineland-Palatinate (1995, 2000, 2001)
  Incl. Squares of pure day or night clinics.
  * Schleswig-Holstein (until 2003)
  Without the day or night clinics.

en.wiki\n==Anteil der Arbeitslosen an den z:
wiki == of the unemployed in the civilian labor force averaged over the year == === === statement The unemployment rate tells you what percentage of applicants registered with the Federal Employment Agency unemployment is related to all civilian employees. The unemployment rate indicates the relative underutilization of the labor force.
  === === indicator calculation unemployment, the relative under-utilization of labor supply indicate by setting the (registered) unemployed to the labor force (= labor force employed + unemployed) in relationship. Here the civilian labor force be used from 2009 onwards. For the calculation of the indicator "of the unemployed in the civilian population in the annual average", that is, the unemployment rate, the unemployment rate is divided by the number of civilian population and multiplying by 100.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data on unemployment and employment, which are included in the employment statistics of employment services and agencies of the Federal Employment Agency.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'unemployed' ''
  Those temporarily non-proportional employment are in or to work only less than 15 hours per week full employment, a policyholder-included mandatory, looking for at least 15 hours per week full employment, are the mediation efforts of the employment agency or the job center available so are allowed to work are able to work and -ready, in the Federal Republic of Germany Land, are not younger than 15 years and have not yet reached the age limit for retirement, have registered in person at an employment agency or job center as unemployed. For need of assistance under SGB II 1 SGB II is in accordance with § 53a para. Unemployment definition of § 16 SGB III apply mutatis mutandis. For the calculation of the indicator "of the unemployed in the civilian population in the annual average", that is, the unemployment rate, the annual average number of unemployed is used (the residence).
 * '' 'Labor' ''
  The circle of the labor force (labor force = employed + unemployed) can be defined in different ways. - All civilian labor force: This includes not only the unemployed all civilian employment to which the dependent civilian labor force and include the self-employed and family workers (s u..). - dependent civilian labor force: This includes not only the unemployed, the dependent civilian labor force, including the full social security contributions (including apprentices.), Marginally employed, persons in employment opportunities (extra cost option), officials (excluding soldiers) and cross-border commuters are. Self-employed and their family workers are not counted.
  Source: Statistics of the Federal Employment Agency (BA)
  === === * Regional characteristics Lower Saxony (2001)
  Results for the region Hannover calculated from the former district of Hannover and the state capital of Hanover (rounding differences are possible).

 For the calculation of the indicator "proportion of foreign unemployed in the unemployed total annual average" is used, the annual average number of unemployed (the residence).

  As unemployed foreigners do not apply German unemployed (foreigners, stateless persons and persons with undetermined nationality) that may exercise a paid employment in the Federal Republic of Germany.
  *'''Foreigners'''
  all persons who are not German within the meaning of Article 116 para. 1 GG apply are under the Aliens Act as a foreigner. This includes stateless persons and persons with unexplained or unknown nationality. Those both the German and have another nationality, are considered as German nationals. en.wiki\n==Durchschnittliche Aufenthaltsdau:
wiki == Average length of stay of guests in accommodation establishments in days == === === statement The indicator Average length of stay provides information on the period of staying of tourists in accommodation establishments. The indicator values ​​provide indications of the predominant type of tourism (business tourism, private urban tourism, leisure, recreation or health tourism).
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator Average length of stay of guests in accommodation establishments in days, the number of overnight stays is divided by the number of visitor arrivals.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data on the number of tourist nights and the tourist arrivals in accommodation establishments according to the monthly surveys on tourism.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'reporting population' ''
  Obliged to provide information are accommodation facilities that house more than nine (by 2011 more than eight) guests (in tourist traffic) at the same time temporarily. This includes accommodation facilities that operate the guest accommodation non-commercial and / or only as a secondary activity. Basically include camping on the report circle. However, the information needed to calculate the indicator do not include camping.
  * '' 'Tourist accommodation' ''
  To accommodation facilities include hotels, rooming houses, inns, guest houses, work activities with accommodation, training centers, school camps, holiday rentals, holiday centers, lodges, hostels and youth herberg similar facilities, also Vorsorgeund rehabilitation facilities.
  * '' 'Overnight stays' ''
  This is to increase the number of overnight stays by guests who stayed during the reporting period in open accommodation establishments (excluding campsites), d. H. for temporary stay occupied a guest bed. The guests may have arrived in the reporting period or have been still present from the previous reporting period.
  * '' 'Guest arrivals' ''
  This is the number of guests who arrived during the reporting period in accommodation establishments (excluding campsites) and temporarily stay occupied a guest bed.
  === === Regional characteristics * Germany, Baden-Wuerttemberg, Berlin, North Rhine-Westphalia, Saxony-Anhalt (since 2004), Bavaria (since 2006), Saarland (from 2008), Brandenburg, Hesse (from 2009), Mecklenburg -Vorpommern, Lower Saxony (from 2010), Saxony (from 2012):
  incl. the campgrounds.
  === === Further information [https://www.destatis.de/DE/Methoden/Qualitaet/Qualitaetsber eights / Hospitality-Tourism / tourism monatserhebung.pdf | Tourism]
  [Https://www.regionalstatistik.de/genesis/online?operation=s tatistikenVerzeichnis | regional database: Areas]
en.wiki\n==\u00dcbernachtungen von G\u00e4s:
wiki == overnight stays by guests in accommodation establishments per inhabitant == === === The statement tourist intensity (overnight density) is a measure of the quantitative importance of tourism in a region. The more nights are booked in relation to the local population, the more important is the tourism industry. Since the nights are only recorded in accommodation facilities from nine to sleep, a part of the actual overnight stays remains (z. B. in small businesses or at relatives or friends), also taken into account as the day tourism.
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator overnight stays by guests in accommodation establishments per capita, the number of overnight stays by guests in accommodation establishments divided by the number of inhabitants. Hence the tourism intensity.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data on the number of overnight stays in tourist accommodation according to the monthly surveys on tourism and the population.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'reporting population' ''
  Obliged to provide information are accommodation facilities that house more than nine (by 2011 more than eight) guests (in tourist traffic) at the same time temporarily. This includes accommodation facilities that operate the guest accommodation non-commercial and / or only as a secondary activity. Basically include camping on the report circle. However, the information needed to calculate the indicator do not include camping.
  * '' 'Tourist accommodation' ''
  To accommodation facilities include hotels, rooming houses, inns, guest houses, work activities with accommodation, training centers, school camps, holiday rentals, holiday centers, lodges, hostels and youth herberg similar facilities, also Vorsorgeund rehabilitation facilities.
  * '' 'Overnight stays' ''
  This is to increase the number of overnight stays by guests who stayed during the reporting period in open accommodation establishments (excluding campsites), d. H. for temporary stay occupied a guest bed. The guests may have arrived in the reporting period or have been still present from the previous reporting period.
  * '' 'Residents' ''
  To the inhabitants of Germany all people are (German and foreign) who have their permanent residence in Germany. but not to the inhabitants include the members of foreign missions and forces. For the calculation of the indicator overnight stays by guests in accommodation establishments per inhabitant, the annual average population is used. By 2010, the average annual population is the arithmetic average of the twelve monthly averages. These are calculated in each case as the arithmetic mean from the beginning and ending of the relevant month. The average population in 2011 is the date population on 9 May 2011. From 2012, the average annual population mean the average of beginning and year end of year.
 
  === === Regional characteristics * Average annual population
  Baden-Wuerttemberg (1995, 2000), Bavaria, Hesse, North Rhine-Westphalia, Lower Saxony, Rhineland-Palatinate, Saarland (until 1999), Saxony (until 2007) the arithmetic mean of the population at the beginning and end of the year.
  * Saxony-Anhalt (until 2006)
  As a result of the district reform on 1 July 2007 is that from 31.12 instead of the average annual population. of the year used.
  * Rhineland-Palatinate (2012)
  The average annual population is the arithmetic average of the twelve monthly averages.
 
  * Germany, Baden-Wuerttemberg, Berlin, North Rhine-Westphalia, Saxony-Anhalt (since 2004), Bavaria (since 2006), Saarland (from 2008), Brandenburg, Hesse (from 2009), Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania, Lower Saxony (from 2010) , Saxony (from 2012)
  Incl. the campgrounds.

en.Stra\u00dfenverkehrsunf\u00e4lle je 10.0: Road traffic accidents per 10,000 motor vehicles
en.wiki\n==Stra\u00dfenverkehrsunf\u00e4lle:
wiki == road traffic accidents per 10,000 motor vehicles == === === statement The indicator is a measure of the frequency of accidents on the road. However, the code has the disadvantage that only the reported on-site vehicle are taken into account and a high traffic or high commuter traffic falsify the result. The extent of traffic is therefore not sufficient account.
  == == indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator 'road traffic accidents per 10,000 motor vehicles' is the number of road accidents in the year by the number of motor vehicles 01.01. the year divided and multiplied by 10,000.
  == Origin == statistics The indicator is based on data from the statistics of road accidents as well as data from the official motor vehicle statistics of the Federal Motor Vehicle Office to the motor vehicle inventory.
  == feature descriptions == * '' 'road accidents' ''
  Proven are those controlled by the police accidents from the reference year 1995, in which were killed or injured as a result of vehicular traffic on public roads and squares persons or material damage. Among the accidents with property damage include serious accidents involving damage to property in the narrow sense in which an offense or a misdemeanor (fine) was present, while at least one vehicle due to an accident damage will be towed from the accident site had, as well as other property damage accidents under the influence of intoxicating substances ( at least one accident participant was under the influence of intoxicating substances, and if car were involved, they were all still roadworthy). Not included are all other property damage accidents without the influence of intoxicating substances. From 1 January 1995, the accidents were established new criteria with property damage within the meaning of the Road Traffic Accident Statistics Act for the acquisition. Unlike previous years under review serves as a collection basis is no longer the height of the resulting material damage, but the determination of whether it is a criminal offense / a misdemeanor and / or at least one accident participant under the influence of alcohol / January 1, 2008 under the influence of intoxicating substances was , the motor pool of vehicles will also be included in the assessment of the accident. Therefore, a comparison with previous years is not possible.
  * '' 'Motor vehicle component' ''
  Which permitted number of vehicles at the time of counting at a specified date (January 1 of each year) with a registration plate for traffic (up to 01.01.2007 including temporarily deregistered vehicles) and in the Central Vehicle Register (ZFZR) of the Federal Motor Vehicle Office (KBA) are stored. Included also vehicles perform an insurance plate, as well as vehicles of the Federal Police and the Technical Relief (THW). are against not include the vehicles of the Bundeswehr as well as vehicles with red or temporary license plate and export license plates. The data on the number of motor vehicles are provided by the Federal Motor Transport Authority in Flensburg.
  == == * Regional characteristics Germany (until 1999)
  Incl. Vehicles with BP marks that are no longer reported separately.
  * Lower Saxony, North Rhine-Westphalia, Rhineland-Palatinate, Bavaria, Brandenburg, Saxony and Saxony-Anhalt (2006)
  Country Total incl. Vehicles that could not be allocated regionally.
  == Further information == [https://www.destatis.de/DE/Methoden/Qualitaet/Qualitaetsber eights / traffic accidents / strassenverkehrsunfaelle.pdf | road accidents]
  [Http://www.kba.de | Federal Motor Vehicle Office]
  [Https://www.regionalstatistik.de/genesis/online?operation=s tatistikenVerzeichnis | regional database: Areas]
en.wiki\n==Armutsgef\u00e4hrdungsquote (Bun:
wiki == poverty rate (Federal median) == === === The statement poverty rate is an indicator for measuring relative low income. The poverty rates is a common poverty threshold based on this indicator. In this analysis, differences are not observed in income levels between the states.
  === indicator calculation === For the calculation of the indicator "poverty rate (federal median)" is according to the EU standards, the number of people with an equivalent income of less than 60% of the national median of equivalent income (poverty threshold) by the population in private households at the site the main residence and multiplying by 100.
 
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data of the microcensus. From the reference year 2011, the projection is based on the updated results of the census 2011th
 
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'equivalent income' ''
  The equivalent income is a needs-weighted per capita income per household member, which is calculated by dividing the household income is divided by the sum of the weights needs of persons living in the household. According to EU standards, the new OECD scale is used for weighting requirement. Thereafter, the first adult person is assigned in the home, the need for weight 1, weights are used by <1 for the other members of the household (0.5 for other people at the age of 14 years or more and 0.3 for each child under the age of 14 years ) because it is assumed that can be achieved by joint economies savings.
  * '' 'Median' ''
  The median is the middle value of a low to high-level data series. Above or is in each half of the cases below the median.
  * '' 'Income poverty (relative)' ''
  the European Union people whose equivalent income is less than 60% of the median of equivalent income of the population (in private households) are considered relative income poverty by definition.
 
  === === Further information [http://www.amtliche-sozialberichterstattung.de/A1armutsgefa ehrdungsquoten.html | Official social reporting]
  [Https://www.destatis.de/DE/Methoden/Qualitaet/Qualitaetsber eights / population / Microcensus 2017.pdf | Mikrozensus]
  [Https://www.regionalstatistik.de/genesis/online?operation=s tatistikenVerzeichnis | regional database: Areas]

  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data of the microcensus. From the reference year 2011, the projection is based on the updated results of the census 2011th

According to EU standards, the new OECD scale is used for weighting requirement. Thereafter, the first adult person is assigned in the home, the need for weight 1, weights are used by <1 for the other members of the household (0.5 for other people at the age of 14 years or more and 0.3 for each child under the age of 14 years ) because it is assumed that can be achieved by joint economies savings.

  The median is the middle value of a low to high-level data series. Above or is in each half of the cases below the median.

en.wiki\n==Anteil der in Tageseinrichtungen:
wiki == share the same in day care centers for children looked after children aged from 0 to 2 years of age the children == === === statement This indicator points to the offer for day care for young children under 3 years in child care centers.
  === indicator calculation === For the calculation of the indicator "share of in day care centers for children looked after children aged from 0 to 2 years on the children of the same age," the number of looked after in day care centers children aged 0 until under 3 years each divided by 31 December of the previous year by the number of inhabitants of the same age and multiplied by 100.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data from the statistics of child round youth services as well as from the population statistics.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'day care' ''
  As a child day care publicly organized and financed the form of day care is called. It belongs to the child and youth services. Its legal basis, it takes place in the Children and Youth Welfare Act. Child day care includes education, training and care of children in day care centers and in publicly funded day care.
  * '' 'Day care center' ''
  Day care centers for children are institutions where children are full-time recorded or for part of the day as well as educational and nursing care that have full- or part-time staff, and for which an operating license according to § 45 SGB VIII or equivalent authorization.
  * '' 'Residents' ''
  To the inhabitants of Germany all people are (German and foreign) who have their permanent residence in Germany. but not to the inhabitants include the members of foreign missions and forces. For the calculation of the indicator "share of in day care centers for children looked after children aged from 0 to 2 years upon the children the same age as a percentage of" the number of residents aged 0 to 3 years is at 31.12. used in the previous year. The population figures are from the statistical bureaus of the federal and state governments and are based in the former West Germany until 2010 on the results of the census of 25 May 1987. In the new federal states on 3 October 1990 established official population is the foundation. As of the 2011 reporting year, the results are presented on the basis of carried out on May 9, 2011 census.

wiki == proportion of supervised in publicly funded day care children aged from 0 to 2 years on the children of the same age == === statement === This indicator points to the offer for day care for young children under 3 years in publicly funded day care ,
  === indicator calculation === is "Proportion of births attended in publicly funded day care children aged from 0 to 2 years on the children of the same age" for the calculation of the indicator, the number of looked after in day care children aged 0 to 3 years each divided by 31 December of the previous year by the number of inhabitants of the same age and multiplied by 100.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data from the statistics of child round youth services as well as from the population statistics.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'day care' ''
  As a child day care publicly organized and financed the form of day care is called. It belongs to the child and youth services. Its legal basis, it takes place in the Children and Youth Welfare Act. Child day care includes education, training and care of children in day care centers and in publicly funded day care.
  * '' 'Day care' ''
  The publicly funded family day care is the temporary care of children at a subsidized by the youth welfare offices childminder (day mother or father day). The publicly funded family day care is in addition to the day-care in child care centers an equivalent form of child day care. Private day care arrangements are not included in this indicator.
  * '' 'Residents' ''
  To the inhabitants of Germany all people are (German and foreign) who have their permanent residence in Germany. but not to the inhabitants include the members of foreign missions and forces. For the calculation of the indicator "Proportion of births attended in publicly funded day care children aged from 0 to 2 years on the children of the same age in percent" is the number of residents aged 0 to under 3 years 31.12. used in the previous year. The population figures are from the statistical bureaus of the federal and state governments and are based in the former West Germany until 2010 on the results of the census of 25 May 1987. In the new federal states on 3 October 1990 established official population is the foundation. As of the 2011 reporting year, the results are presented on the basis of carried out on May 9, 2011 census.
  === === Regional characteristics Mecklenburg-Vorpommern: As a result of local government reform in 2011 can be viewed on the county level for the year 2011, no values. Lower Saxony: The merging of the districts of Göttingen and Osterode am Harz on November 1, 2016 can no values ​​are displayed for the county level for the year 2016 for the new district Göttingen.

  Day care centers for children are institutions where children are full-time recorded or for part of the day as well as educational and nursing care that have full- or part-time staff, and for which an operating license according to § 45 SGB VIII or equivalent authorization.

  To the inhabitants of Germany all people are (German and foreign) who have their permanent residence in Germany. but not to the inhabitants include the members of foreign missions and forces. For the calculation of the indicator "share of in day care centers for children cared for children aged 3 to 5 years to the children of the same age as a percentage of" the number of residents aged 3 to 5 years of 31.12 is. used in the previous year. The population figures are from the statistical bureaus of the federal and state governments and are based in the former West Germany until 2010 on the results of the census of 25 May 1987. In the new federal states on 3 October 1990 established official population is the foundation. As of the 2011 reporting year, the results are presented on the basis of carried out on May 9, 2011 census.

en.wiki\n==Durchschnittliche Anzahl der Woh:
wiki == Average number of dwellings per residential building == === === The statement indicator provides information on the average size of residential buildings based on the number of apartments.
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator Average number of dwellings per residential building to the date May 9, 2011, the number of apartments divided by the number of residential buildings (excluding hostels) in total. It excludes commercial apartments.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data of the performed 9 May 2011 register-based census.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'flat' ''
  Under apartment are exterior completed, specific for residential purposes to understand together lying areas in the rule that allow running their own budget and are not fully used for commercial purposes. An apartment is not necessarily a kitchen or kitchenette have. Apartments have a private entrance directly from the outside, from a stairwell or an anteroom. The apartment but lying, for residential purposes developed basement or attic rooms (eg. As mansard) may also belong outside the actual apartment statements.
  * '' 'Residential buildings excluding hostels' ''
  Buildings that are used at least half of the total floor space for residential purposes.
  === === Further information [https://ergebnisse.zensus2011.de/|Auswertungsdatenbank]
  [Https://www.regionalstatistik.de/genesis/online?operation=s tatistikenVerzeichnis | regional database: Areas]

en.wiki\n==Gewerbeanmeldungen ohne \u00dcbe:
wiki == business registrations without acquisitions per 10,000 population == === === statement This indicator points to start-ups in the region under consideration.
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator "business registrations without acquisitions per 10,000 population" dividing the number of business registrations without acquisitions by the number of inhabitants on an annual average and multiplied by 10,000.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data of the business registration statistics and population statistics.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'business registrations' ''
  Detected, the number of commercial applications (without vending machine and travel industry). A declaration shall be lodged at
 - new construction of a commercial operation (start-up and - Establishment of the Conversion Act), - reopening after laying (immigration), - acquisition of an existing operation (purchase, lease, inheritance - change of legal form, shareholder admission).
 Operating foundations: starting a business (head office, branch office, dependent branch office) by a legal entity, a company without legal personality (partnerships) or a natural person. In a natural person who signs a principal branch condition is that it is registered either in the Register or has a trade card, or at least employed an employee.
 This indicator acquisitions will not be considered an existing establishment.
  * '' 'Residents' ''
  To the inhabitants of Germany all people are (German and foreign) who have their permanent residence in Germany. but not to the inhabitants include the members of foreign missions and forces. For the calculation of the indicator "business registrations without acquisitions per 10,000 population YYYY" the annual average number of inhabitants is used. By 2010, the average annual population is the arithmetic average of the twelve monthly averages. These are calculated in each case as the arithmetic mean from the beginning and ending of the relevant month. The average population in 2011 is the date population on 9 May 2011. From 2012, the average annual population mean the average of beginning and year end of year.
  === === Regional characteristics Mecklenburg-Vorpommern: As a result of local government reform in 2011 can be viewed on the county level for the year 2011, no values.
  === === Further information [https://www.destatis.de/DE/Methoden/Qualitaet/Qualitaetsber eights / Company / gewerbeanzeigen.pdf | business registration statistics]
  [Https://www.destatis.de/DE/Methoden/Qualitaet/Qualitaetsber eights / population / population projection-2017.pdf | population projection]
  [Https://www.regionalstatistik.de/genesis/online?operation=s tatistikenVerzeichnis | regional database: Areas]
en.wiki\n==Investitionen im Verarbeitenden:
wiki == investments in manufacturing, mining and quarrying and earth per employee EUR 1 000 == === === statement indicator provides information about the investment per person employed in local units of manufacturing.
  === === indicator calculation, the investment in units of manufacturing and mining and quarrying and earth for the calculation of the indicator 'investment in manufacturing, mining and the extraction of mineral products per employee in 1000 EUR' all divided into 1,000 EUR by the number of employees.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data from the 'investment survey in the area of ​​manufacturing, mining and quarrying and earth'.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'operations' ''
  The companies represent local units; they are indistinguishable from the company as the smallest legally independent units. Proven are all operations as of December 31 of the year, regardless of whether investments were made in the financial year or not.
  * '' 'Employees' ''
  People who have a contractual duty ratio or duty ratio for operating stand (including trainees), as well as bearer automatic deemed workers (s) and co-owner (s), further unpaid family members, as far as it operates at least one third of the normal working hours in operation are. Proven are employees of all businesses as of September 30 of the year, regardless of whether investments were made in the financial year or not.
  * '' 'Investments in companies' ''
  Investment is the amount of capitalized gross additions to fixed assets during the financial year, d. H. Replacement and new investments (including activatable major repairs and low-value assets, as well as internally developed and under construction plants). This does not include the payments on investments if they are not already enabled investments in foreign branches, access through the purchase of entire companies or establishments, financing costs incurred in investments, transfers from investment accounts to other asset accounts, the acquisition of financial assets and the acquisition of concessions, patents, licenses, etc.
  === === Further information [https://www.destatis.de/DE/Methoden/Qualitaet/Qualitaetsber eights / Industrial-Manufacturing-commercial / investment survey processed-gewerbe.pdf | investment survey on businesses and enterprises]
  [Https://www.regionalstatistik.de/genesis/online?operation=s tatistikenVerzeichnis | regional database: Areas]
en.wiki\n==Aufkommen an Haus- und Sperrm\u0:
wiki == volume of domestic and bulky waste per inhabitant == === === statement indicator provides information about the average per capita volume of domestic and bulky waste from private households.
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator volume of household and bulky per inhabitant dividing the volume of domestic and bulky household waste by the total population (each at 31.12.).
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data from the survey of the public waste disposal and the statistics of the updating of the population stocks.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'domestic and bulky waste' ''
  For domestic and bulky waste are depending on the particular collection system in regionally varying degrees in addition to domestic waste (so-called. Residual waste) and bulky waste and household-type commercial waste that are collected together on the public garbage disposal. are in the data for domestic and bulky waste not delivered separately from household waste or collected household-type commercial waste.
  *'''Population'''
  The population of a municipality since the early 80s includes all persons in this community their sole or main residence have ((§ 21f Federal Registration Act -. BMG of 3 May 2013 (Federal Law Gazette I p 1084), as amended established by Article 2 law of 11 October 2016 (Federal law Gazette I, p. 2218)). Previously, the population was at the place of sole or predominantly used apartment acquired (resident population). the annual update of the population is performed using the results of the statistics of natural population change over the births and deaths, marriages, divorces, be-ups and cancellation of civil partnerships, the migration statistics on entries and exits, as well as inventory adjustments due to subsequently filed reports of Standes- and registration offices. the population data from the reference year 2011 are to update numbers based on the results of the census, 09 May 2011th the B evölkerungsdaten from 31 December 1987 to 2010 are created in the former West Germany due to the census of 25 May 1987, in the former East Germany which established on 3 October 1990 due to an extract of the central population register of the former GDR official population forms the basis , The population count also reported in the Federal Territory foreigners (including stateless persons and those seeking protection). Not the population, however, the members of the armed forces stationed in and the foreign diplomatic and consular missions, with their family members.
  === === * Regional characteristics All countries
  Due to the different regional organization of public waste household waste contains varying degrees household-type commercial waste (so-called business waste). For the same reason are not separate results for individual circuits. For circular cross-waste, the values ​​are determined by calculation or designated as "No data available".

en.wiki\n==Aufkommen an getrennt erfassten:
wiki == volume of separately collected recyclables per capita == === === statement indicator provides information about the average per capita volume of separately collected from households recyclables.
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator volume of separately collected substances per inhabitant is (in each case 31.12.) Dividing the volume of valuable substances by the total population.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data from the survey of the public waste disposal and the statistics of the updating of the population stocks.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'Separately collected recyclables' ''
  Separately collected valuable materials are collected for recycling suitable waste which is separated from the domestic waste (residual waste) and bulky in specifically provided for collecting containers (yellow e.g. tons / bags) or to appropriate collection (e.g., recycling centers) are delivered. To the separately collected materials include mixed packaging, glass, paper, cardboard, metals, wood, plastics and textiles.
  *'''Population'''
  The population of a municipality since the early 80s includes all persons in this community their sole or main residence have ((§ 21f Federal Registration Act -. BMG of 3 May 2013 (Federal Law Gazette I p 1084), as amended established by Article 2 law of 11 October 2016 (Federal law Gazette I, p. 2218)). Previously, the population was at the place of sole or predominantly used apartment acquired (resident population). the annual update of the population is performed using the results of the statistics of natural population change over the births and deaths, marriages, divorces, be-ups and cancellation of civil partnerships, the migration statistics on entries and exits, as well as inventory adjustments due to subsequently filed reports of Standes- and registration offices. the population data from the reference year 2011 are to update numbers based on the results of the census, 09 May 2011th the B evölkerungsdaten from 31 December 1987 to 2010 are created in the former West Germany due to the census of 25 May 1987, in the former East Germany which established on 3 October 1990 due to an extract of the central population register of the former GDR official population forms the basis , The population count also reported in the Federal Territory foreigners (including stateless persons and those seeking protection). Not the population, however, the members of the armed forces stationed in and the foreign diplomatic and consular missions, with their family members.

en.wiki\n==Verf\u00fcgbares Einkommen der p:
wiki == Disposable income of private households including non-profit institutions per capita in EUR == === === statement indicator provides information on the (monetary) wealth of the population and should be understood as the average amount of per capita is available for consumption and saving purposes.
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator "Disposable income of private households including non-profit institutions per capita in EUR" dividing the value of disposable income in current prices in the year by the number of inhabitants in the annual average.
  With these results, it is results of the audit in 2014 of the national accounts of the countries. The VGR general revision in 2014 is primarily the European launch of the new European System of Accounts (ESA 2010), which brings a wide range of conceptual changes. In addition, all previous calculations and results were reviewed and, where possible, integrate new knowledge, methodological improvements and new data sources into the calculator.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data of the working group "National Accounts of the countries". (Calculated as of the Federal Statistical Office: August 2015)
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'Disposable income of private households' ''
  Disposable income is to be understood as the amount that is available to households for consumption purposes or savings available. This results in that the primary income monetary benefits (pensions, unemployment benefits, child support, etc.) and other current transfers are added and the social contributions and other current transfers and income taxes and other taxes that are to be made by households, subtracted from. The primary household income includes earned income and assets, accrued to the domestic private households (z. B. Self-employed income, compensation of employees).
  * '' 'Households including non-profit institutions' ''
  Households occur primarily as providers of labor, as the last buyer of supply and consumer goods, and as an investor of savings. Your earnings are not solely dependent on the market, because in addition to earned income and assets and income from transfers play (pensions, pensions, subsidies, etc.) play a role. In the regional accounts, households have to be summarized for methodological reasons, the NPISHs. The private non-profit organizations is, associations, institutes, etc., which do not belong to the government sector, but their services deliver the cost-covering prices also free or at not full. They deny their expenses - except for special charges - to a large extent by contributions and donations from households.
  * '' 'Residents' ''
  To the inhabitants of Germany all people are (German and foreign) who have their permanent residence in Germany. but not to the inhabitants include the members of foreign missions and forces. For the calculation of the indicator "Disposable income of private households including non-profit institutions per capita in EUR 'is used, the average annual number of inhabitants based on the census 2011th The average annual population is the arithmetic mean of-year and end of year.
  === Regional characteristics === Since "Accounts of the States Economic" the data are published regularly area adjusted by the Working Group, may due to the formation of the Hannover Region (2001), the Aachen region (2009) and the regional reforms in Saxony-Anhalt (2007 , Saxony (2008) and Mecklenburg-Vorpommern (display 2011) for the county level for the particular ahead of that date reporting year no values).
  === === Further information [https://www.destatis.de/DE/Methoden/Qualitaet/Qualitaetsber eights / National-accounts / volkswirtschafli che-gesamtrechnungen.pdf | Federal Statistical Office "Economics and Statistics"]
  [Http://www.vgrdl.de/VGRdL/ | Working Group National accounts of countries] [http://www.vgrdl.de/VGRdL/MethDef/brochure.pdf | Working Group National accounts of countries - Booklet]

wiki is == share of newly constructed residential buildings with one or two apartments at the newly built residential buildings total == === === statement, the share of residential buildings with 1 or 2 apartments in total Wohngebäudeneubestand a parameter for describing the structure of the regional Neuwohnbaus ,
  === indicator calculation === For the calculation of the indicator "proportion of new residential building with 1 or 2 apartments to the new residential buildings total of" the number of new residential building with 1 or 2 apartments by the number of new residential building as a whole and multiplying by 100.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data for new residential buildings that are included in the statistics of housing completions.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'building' ''
  When building the system of the buildings usable, covered structures, which are built over time apply according independently. They can be entered by humans and are likely or intended to serve the protection of people, animals or property. A key criterion is the canopy. Building in this sense can also g independently usable underground structures with the o.. Intended to be (z. B. underground hospitals, load centers, underground car parks).
  * '' 'Home' ''
  Residential buildings, which at least half (as measured by the living space of the total) are used building residential purposes. Among the residential buildings include dormitories. These apply to the indicator calculation than residential buildings having more than 2 apartments.
  * '' 'Construction of new residential buildings' ''
  Under newly constructed residential buildings or re-structures are understood, which destroyed or demolished residential building is considered reconstruction of the building from the top edge of the remaining basement.
  *'''Apartments'''
  Under a residential spaces are to be understood outside completed, specific for residential purposes, together lying in the rule that allow the leadership of an autonomous budget. One apartment has basically its own lockable access directly from the outside, from the staircase or from an anteroom, further water supply, sink and toilet. The apartment but lying, for residential purposes developed basement or attic rooms (eg. As mansard) may also belong outside the actual apartment statements.
 Beginning with the reporting year 2012, "Other housing units" are valid, d. H. Dwellings without kitchen or fixed cooking facilities, as "flat".

en.wiki\n==Anteil der Siedlungs- und Verkeh:
wiki == share of housing and transport in the total area of ​​31.12. == === === statement indicator provides information on the use of non-renewable total area of ​​an area by the use for settlement and transport purposes.
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator portion of the housing and transport area to the total area of ​​the housing and transport area is divided by the total and multiplying by 100.

en.wiki\n==Unternehmensinsolvenzen je 10.00:
wiki == corporate insolvencies per 10,000 VAT registered businesses == === === statement This indicator points to the presence of over-indebted and insolvent companies.
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator "sales tax corporate insolvencies per 10,000 companies" is the number of corporate insolvencies divided by the number of VAT registered businesses and multiplied by 10,000.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data from the insolvency statistics and the turnover tax statistics.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'Umsatzsteuerpflichtige' ''
  In the VAT statistics the terms entrepreneur, tax payer and taxpayer are used interchangeably. According to § 2 Abs. 1 UStG is an entrepreneur who pursues commercial or professional activity. Commercial or professional is any stable activity for generating revenue, even if the profit motive is absent or an association of persons shall act only against their members. It depends neither on the legal form nor the legal capacity. to be self-employed is to complete work on their own account and responsibility. Entrepreneurs natural and legal persons of private and public law can be. The legal entities of public law have so far their commercial operations and their agricultural or forestry businesses operating commercially or professionally only in the context and sales tax legally relevant {(§ 2 para. 3 UStG? Repealed by Art. 12 no. 2 of the Act v from 02.11.2015 (Federal Law Gazette I 1834) m. W.. 01/01/2016). The new §2b VAT Act provides for changes here. It entered into force on 01.01.2016, its use is mandatory but only from the 01/01/2021. According §2b UStG legal entities of public law are not considered as entrepreneurs if they engage in activities as part of their public authority. Of these, there are some exceptions (§2b (4) UStG)}. Part of a company more establishments or in situations involving affiliation relationship, all sales headquarters are (i.d.R. place of effective management) of the company or of the controlling recorded and statistically proven. The data for VAT returns will be sent to the official statistics by the tax authorities annually.
  * '' 'Insolvency proceedings' ''
  The bankruptcy procedure is designed to satisfy the creditors of a debtor jointly by realizing the assets of the debtor and the proceeds distributed or taken to an insolvency plan different arrangements especially for obtaining the company. This indicator only corporate insolvencies are taken into account, so no insolvencies of consumers and other debtors.
  === === Regional characteristics Mecklenburg-Vorpommern: As a result of local government reform in 2011 can be viewed on the county level for the year 2011, no values. Saxony: As a result of local government reform in 2008 can be viewed on the county level for the year 2007, no values.
  === === Further information [https://www.destatis.de/DE/Methoden/Qualitaet/Qualitaetsber eights / Company / insolvenzen.pdf https://www.destatis.de/DE/Methoden/Qualitaet/Qualitaetsberi FRUITS / company / finished-insolvenzverfahren.pdf | insolvency Statistics]
