en.wiki\n==Bruttoentgelte im Verarbeitenden:
wiki == gross earnings in manufacturing as well as mining and mining and quarrying per employee EUR 1,000 == === === statement indicator provides information on the earnings in manufacturing and in mining and quarrying and earth.
  === indicator calculation === For the calculation of the indicator 'gross charges in the manufacturing industry and the mining and extraction of stones and earths per employed in 1,000 EUR', the gross charges EUR 1,000 (years total) by the number of employees at 30.9. divided.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based data of monthly and annual report for companies in the 'Manufacturing, mining and quarrying and earth'.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'reporting population' ''
  The reporting of the monthly report for establishments of enterprises in the manufacturing sector and the mining and extraction of mineral products with 50 or more employees. The reporting of the annual report for companies includes: - enterprises in the manufacturing sector and the mining and extraction of mineral products with less than 50 employees belonging to companies in the manufacturing sector with generally 20 or more employees; - enterprises in the manufacturing sector and the mining and extraction of mineral products which generally have 20 to 49 employees of companies in the other sectors of the economy. The coverage includes processing companies of the craft. The annual report a cutoff threshold of 10 employees is valid for seven sectors. The selection is made according to the number of employees in the end of September last year. In contrast, the reported number of employees relates to the end of September of the year. The characteristic values ​​refer to the entire operation, thus closing the non-producing operation parts with a. Decisive for the assignment of the 'Classification of Economic Activities, 2008 edition (WZ 2008)' is from 2009, namely, sections B and C.
  * '' 'Operations' ''
  The companies represent local units; they are indistinguishable from the company as the smallest legal entities.
  * '' 'Employees' ''
  People who have a contractual duty ratio or duty ratio for operating stand (including trainees), as well as working owners are considered workers (s) and co-owner (s), further unpaid family members, when they operate at least one third of the normal working hours in operation ,
  * '' 'Gross charges' ''
  Gross total charges without obligation shares of the employer's social security. involved continued remuneration, surcharges, including gratuities.

en.wiki\n==Anteil der \u00f6kologisch bewir:
includes wiki == proportion of organic area in the total agricultural area == === === The indicator statement the converted and the surface of the agricultural organic farms located in-conversion. With respect to the factor space, he describes the regional significance of organic farming.
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator portion of the organic area in the agricultural area in total is multiplied organic management and overall the area of ​​the farms located in conversion divided by organically produced by the agricultural area and with 100 ,
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data from the Farm Structure Survey.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'reporting population' ''
  Since 2010 only farms are a agricultural area (LF) of at least 5 ha or with at least - 10 cattle or 50 pigs or 10 sows or in each case 20 sheep or 20 goats or 1000 pieces poultry or - 0.5 ha hops or 0.5 ha tobacco or - 1.0 ha permanent crops in the open field or per 0.5 ha Obstanbau-, vine or tree nursery area or - 0.5 ha vegetables or strawberries, outdoor ha or 0.3 flowers or ornamental plants outdoor or - 0.1 ha cultures included under glass or other accessible protective covers or 0.1 ha edible mushrooms in the processing.
  * '' 'Farms' ''
  An agricultural holding is a technical and economic unit comprising one of the above minimum sizes, a single management subject and agricultural products or in addition, services and other products produces. to achieve the purpose of profit, is not required.
  * '' 'Organic farms' ''
  These include agricultural businesses, where all vegetable and / or animal products or parts of these biological accordance with the principles applicable from 01.01.2009 Regulation (EC) no. 834/2007 on / organic production and labeling of organic / products are produced. These businesses must be certified in a mandatory control procedures from a state-approved inspection agency.
  * '' 'Agricultural area (LF)' ''
  The area of ​​agricultural (LF) includes all agriculturally or horticulturally exploited areas, including the set-aside land. To LF expect the following specific crops: - farmland including horticultural crops, strawberries and greenhouse plants as well as from agricultural production Taken arable land - permanent grassland, including from agricultural production Taken permanent pasture - kitchen gardens - trees and berry plantations (excluding strawberries) and nuts - nursery areas (excluding forestry nurseries for their own use), - vineyards, - Christmas trees (outside the forest) - other permanent crops (eg osier plants) - permanent crops under glass or other walk-lasting protective devices (without protection and shadow networks) , Short rotation plantations are part of the forest and not used for agricultural area. The area specified in column 2 also includes the areas which are not included in the organic production method. All to an operating mating surfaces are detected in those community in which the operating seat is (operation principle).
  * '' 'Upgraded agricultural area' ''
  Utilized agricultural area on which the transition is complete to organic farming under the provisions of Regulation (EC) no. 834/2007. The agricultural products produced on this surface may already be labeled as organic products and markets.
  * '' 'In conversion agricultural area located' ''
  Utilized agricultural area, which is located under the provisions of Regulation (EC) no. 834/2007 currently in transition. The conversion period includes agriculture two years before sowing or planting in one or more than one year cultures, two years for grassland and clover grass to use (recycling as animal feed) and three years before harvest for perennial crops (standing permanent crops) other than grassland. During this time, the agricultural products produced on such areas may not be labeled as organic and marketed.
  * '' 'Non-upgraded agricultural area' ''
  These include the agricultural area under the management control of companies with organic farming, but was not converted to the organic production method under Regulation (EC) no. 834/2007, nor is in transition.
  === === Regional characteristics * Only data for regional units available, where the results are not subject to secrecy.

Of the previous year", ie the employment rate, the number is subject to social insurance employees (at the residence) at 30.06. by the number of residents aged 15 to 64 at 31.12. of the previous year and multiplying by 100.

Employment insurance in at least one of the branches of social security (pension, health / nursing care insurance, labor insurance loose). 3. It is in paid employment or work that is generally paid a fee (the exceptions are interrupted offenses such. As parental leave). 4. It is worked at least one hour a week? as far from the Group Definition recognizable. This includes those of a social insurance employment to community service statutory duties (eg. As military exercise) to be convened. Not included among the social insurance contributions officials and civil servants, self-employed and family workers, professional and regular soldiers, and Wehrund community service (see o. G. Exception). Workers (MiniJobber) and short-term workers are not detected here. Cases without providing further breakdown characteristics are reported only in the total of positions.
 Evidence of social insurance contributions on a residence on the basis of information provided by employers or registration authorities. For the calculation of the indicator "share of social insurance contributions (at the residence) at 30.06. In the population aged 15 to 64 at 31.12. Last year," the number of registered employees at 30.06 is. of the year used.

en.wiki\n==Anteil der weiblichen sozialvers:
wiki == proportion of female social insurance contributions (at the residence) at 30.06. on the female population aged 15 to 64 at 31.12. last year == === === statement The employment rate of women (or female employee stock) represents the extent to which the female population of a region is located in a social insurance employment. In the cities are often found below-average employment rates compared to surrounding areas. This can u. a. be due to the fact that the city residents often not employed social insurance (eg. as civil servants, self-employed) or are not economically active.
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator "proportion of female social insurance contributions (at the residence) on 30.06. On the female population aged 15 to 64 at 31.12. Of the previous year", ie the employment rate of women, the number of female social insurance contributions (at the residence) at 30.06. by the number of female population aged 15 to 64 at 31.12. of the previous year and multiplying by 100.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data on social insurance contributions of labor market statistics to the employment services and agencies of the Federal Employment Agency and to the population.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'social insurance contributions' ''
  Maximum age of social security contributions persons who meet all the following criteria: 1. An employer's social security message is available. 2. Employment insurance in at least one of the branches of social security (pension, health / nursing care insurance, unemployment insurance). 3. It is in paid employment or work that is generally paid a fee (the exceptions are interrupted offenses such. As parental leave). 4. It is worked at least one hour a week? as far from the Group Definition recognizable. This includes those of a social insurance employment to community service statutory duties (eg. As military exercise) to be convened. Not included among the social insurance contributions officials and civil servants, self-employed and family workers, professional and regular soldiers, and Wehrund community service (see o. G. Exception). Workers (MiniJobber) and short-term workers are not detected here. Cases without providing further breakdown characteristics are reported only in the total of positions.
 Evidence of social insurance contributions on a residence on the basis of information provided by employers or registration authorities. For the calculation of the indicator "share of social insurance contributions (at the residence) at 30.06. In the population aged 15 to 64 at 31.12. Of the previous year as a percentage of" the number of registered employees at 30.06 is. of the year used.
  *'''Population'''
  For Germany's population includes all persons (German and foreign) who have their permanent residence in Germany. but not to these residents include the members of foreign missions and forces. For the calculation of the indicator portion of the social security employees subject (the place of residence) on 30.06. of the population aged 15 to 64 at 31.12. last year as a percentage, the number of residents aged 15 to 64 at 31.12. used in the previous year. The population figures are from the statistical bureaus of the federal and state governments and are based in the former West Germany until 2010 on the results of the census of 25 May 1987. In the new federal states on 3 October 1990 established official population is the foundation. As of the 2011 reporting year, the results are presented on the basis of carried out on May 9, 2011 census.

en.wiki\n==Gesamtbetrag der Eink\u00fcnfte:
wiki == total income per taxpayer 1,000 EUR == === === statement indicator provides information on the total amount of income per taxpayer.
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator "Total earnings per taxpayer in 1,000 EUR" dividing the total income in 1,000 EUR by the number of employees taxable income.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data of the wage and income tax statistics.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'personal income taxpayer' ''
  The personal income taxpayer is unlimited income tax individuals. These include the non-assessed and assessed workers and the assessed income taxpayers who respect no wage income. Spouses who were jointly assessed for income tax purposes, count as a taxpayer. Loss cases d. H. assessed personal income taxpayers with negative income (until 1995) and with a negative total income (from 1998) are not included. Border commuters d. H. Taxpayers residing abroad, which can be assess at his own request as fully taxable for income tax will not be shown in this table.
  *'''Total amount of income'''
  The total amount of income is the balance of positive and negative income from the statutory seven types of income subject to certain Hinzurechnungs- and deductions.
  * '' 'Notes on the results of 2004' ''
  The results for 2004 are the results of previous years only partially comparable, since up to 2001 rewarding taxable persons who could not perform income tax assessment could be only to the extent included in the statistics were made available as their tax cards to collection sites. It was not until the 2004 financial year be non-assessed income tax payers due to the introduction of electronic income tax certificates, largely fully demonstrated.
  *'''Regional particularities'''
  Mecklenburg-Vorpommern: As a result of local government reform in 2011 can no values ​​are displayed for the county level for the year 2011th
  === === Further information [https://www.destatis.de/DE/Methoden/Qualitaet/Qualitaetsber eights / tax / wage-and-einkommensteuer.pdf | income tax]

en.wiki\n==Anteil der Personen mit Migratio:
wiki == percentage of people with an immigrant background in the population in private households == === statement === This indicator provides information on the proportion of people (/ nationals Foreign and German with an immigrant background) with an immigrant background in the population in private households, showing with how high the proportion of people who immigrated to Germany from abroad or are descendants of immigrants.
  === indicator calculation === For the calculation of the indicator "proportion of people with an immigrant background in the population in private households" 9 percent at the closing in May 2011, dividing the number of people with an immigrant background by the population in private households and multiplying by 100.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data of the performed 9 May 2011 register-based census.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'population' ''
  For the population, the population, the 9th at the closing in May 2011 include their primary residence in the municipality had. Not to the population are foreign nationals working of the Army, the police and the Foreign Service and their families living there.
  * '' 'Household' ''
  As a household budget is referred to, which consists only of those have their own financial management. A household consists of at least one person. All persons regardless of their residential status (primary / secondary residence) live together in an apartment, are considered to be members of the same household, such that there is one household per occupied dwelling. People in community or institutional households are not included here. A person of private household is defined as a caregiver. On the basis of that person's household type and the position of other people who are authorized within the home.
  * '' 'Migration background' ''
  As people from immigrant backgrounds all immigrant and non-immigrant aliens / inside and all immigrant to the current territory of the Federal Republic of Germany after 1955 Germans and all Germans are defined with at least one immigrant to the current territory of the Federal Republic of Germany after 1955 parent. / Nationals Foreign nationals are persons who do not have German nationality.
 
  === === Further information [https://ergebnisse.zensus2011.de/|Auswertungsdatenbank]
  [Https://www.regionalstatistik.de/genesis/online?operation=s tatistikenVerzeichnis | regional database: Areas]

en.wiki\n==Bruttoinlandsprodukt in jeweilig:
wiki == gross domestic product per work done at current prices working hours of persons employed in EUR == === === statement The gross domestic product (GDP) per hour worked of employed persons is referred to as labor productivity. The indicator shows the value added per hour worked and so describes the efficiency of the use of labor. Other resources used are not considered. Labor productivity in industry typically higher than in the service sector. In this respect, regional differences arise large part from differences in economic structure.
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator "gross domestic product at current prices per hour worked of employees in EUR", the value of gross domestic product is divided into current prices by the number of hours worked of employed persons.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data of the working group "National Accounts of the countries". (Calculated as of the Federal Statistical Office: August 2017)
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'GDP' ''
  The gross domestic product includes the value of all within an economic territory during a certain period produced goods and services.
  * '' 'Volume of work' ''
  Worked represent actually worked of all workers, as workers (workers, employees, civil servants, judges, marginally employed, soldiers) or exercise a self-employed or as unpaid family workers directed to economic inactivity. This includes the hours worked by persons with multiple simultaneous jobs. On the other hand not include the paid but not worked, for example, annual leave, parental leave, holidays, working hours or sick leave to the working volume. It also excludes the unpaid breaks for taking meals and the time spent traveling from home to work and back. The working volume thus includes the total number of during the reporting period on each job of workers and self-employed within a region actually worked. It takes into account neither the intensity nor quality of the work. The working volume is the product of number of employed persons and hours worked per employee.
 Unlike the results of the regional working volume accounting for the countries the results are referred to the independent cities and counties as the default working volume. This should be taken into account that are not considered due to lack of statistical output data company-specific Special provisions for tariff working hours in the calculations the fact.
  * '' 'Gainfully employed' ''
  As workers (domestic) all persons are considered who engage within an economic territory an activity or economic activities, regardless of the length of the actual payments or contractually weekly working time to be paid. After the professional status is a distinction between self-employed and family workers or employees (workers and employees, marginal employees, civil servants). In the working population (residents) the employment is in contrast to the domestic concept not found after the place of work, but on a residence.
  *'''Regional particularities'''

en.wiki\n==Anteil der Empf\u00e4nger sozial:
wiki == proportion of recipients of minimum social security benefits in the population (minimum hedging ratio) == === === statement The indicator shows how high is the percentage of people in the population receiving benefits from the minimum social security systems in Germany. The "hidden" or "bashful" poverty of people who are indeed eligible but do not make that claim is not recognized.
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator "proportion of recipients of minimum social security benefits to the population" is the number of recipients of minimum social security benefits in December by the population at 31.12. and multiplying by 100.
  === origin statistics === The indicator is based on data of the "statistics on the beneficiaries of the aid for subsistence," the "statistics on the recipients of basic security in old age and disability," the "asylum seeker performance statistics" and "Statistics of updating the population stocks "of the statistical offices of the federal and state governments as well as on data from the" Statistics of basic security for jobseekers (SGB II statistics) "of the Federal employment Agency.
  Note: In April 2016, the previous count and validity concept of the statistics of basic security for job-seekers under the SGB was retroactively revised from the introduction of statistics in 2005 II. The data for the basic provision for jobseekers under SGB II is data after revision 2016th
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'Minimum social security benefits' ''
  Transfer payments of minimum social security systems are financial assistance from the State paid to secure the basic livelihood of high-authorized persons. These include the social reporting in official statistics the following: total control power under SGB II "basic security for job seekers" (unemployment benefits, social assistance), assistance for subsistence outside institutions, basic security in old age and disability under SGB XII as well as standard benefits under the Asylum Seekers Benefits Act ,
  *'''Population'''
  The population of a municipality since the early 80s includes all persons in this community their sole or the main dwelling have ((§ 21f BundesmeldegesetzBMG of 3 May 2013 (Federal Law Gazette I, p. 1084), as amended by Article 2 of the Law of October 11, 2016 (Federal Law Gazette I, p. 2218)). Previously has been detected in the population at the site of sole or predominantly used flat (resident population-tion). the annual update of the population is performed using the results of the statistics of natural population change over the births and deaths, marriages, divorces, rationales and cancellation of civil partnerships, migration statistics on the intake and exhaust trainset, and inventory adjustments due to subsequently filed reports of Standes- and registration offices. the population data from the reference year 2011 is updating figures on results the census of 09 May 2011 based. the population insurance data from 31 December 1987-2010 are created in the former West Germany due to the census of 25 May 1987, in the former East Germany is the established on 3 October 1990 due to an extract of the central population register of the former GDR official population the basis. The population count also reported in the Federal Territory foreigners (including stateless persons and those seeking protection). Not the population, however, the members of the armed forces stationed in and the foreign diplomatic and consular missions, with their family members.
  === === * Regional characteristics Mecklenburg-Vorpommern
  As a result of local government reform in 2011 to 2011, no values ​​are displayed for the county level for the reference years 2010 and.
  === === Further information [http://www.amtliche-sozialberichterstattung.de/pdf/Datenque llen_Mindestsicherungssysteme_090619.pdf | statistics on social Mindestsicherungssytemen]

en.wiki\n==Anteil der M\u00e4nner am p\u00e:
wiki == proportion of men on educational staff in day-care facilities for children == === === statement indicator provides information on the proportion of men in the teaching staff in day care centers for children.
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator "proportion of men in the teaching staff in day-care facilities for children", the number of male teaching staff divided by the total number of teaching staff and multiplied by 100.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data from Statistics of children and persons who work in day care centers.
 
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'day care center for children' ''
  Day care centers for children are facilities that are where recorded children aged from 0 to 13 years full time or for part of the day as well as educational and nursing care that have full- or part-time staff and for an operating license according to § 45 SGB VIII or a comparable authorization is present.
  * '' 'Teaching staff' ''
  These are persons who are engaged in or 1.Arbeitsbereich in the work areas Group Management, second and supplementary force, encouraging children to SGB VIII or SGB XII across groups at the facility.
  *'''Regional particularities'''
  Mecklenburg-Vorpommern: As a result of local government reform in 2011 can no values ​​are displayed for the county level for the year 2011th

en.wiki\n==Anzahl der Personen ab 65 Jahren:

wiki == number of people under 20 and over 65 years per 100 persons in the typical working age (20 to 64) (overall ratio) == === === statement indicator provides information on the ratio of the number of people who typically or not is no longer of working age, the number of people in the typical working age. en.wiki\n==Anteil der Bruttowertsch\u00f6pf:
wiki == share of gross value added in Landund forestry, fishing on the total gross value added at current prices == === === statement The gross value added (GVA) of the industry Landund forestry and fishing provides information on the value of the economic performance of this economic sector and thus includes basically all goods and services produced for consideration in the economic sector Agriculture, forestry and fishing. The indicator is based GVA of the industry Agriculture, forestry and fisheries on the total value added of all sectors and thereby the importance of the industry Agriculture, forestry and fisheries in the economy happening again.
  === === indicator calculation "share of gross value added in agriculture, forestry, fisheries total of gross value added" For the calculation of the indicator at current prices the value of the gross value added at current prices of the area agriculture, forestry and fishing in divided by the value in the total gross value added at current prices, so all areas and multiplied by 100.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data of the working group "National Accounts of the countries". (Calculated as of the Federal Statistical Office: November 2014)
  === === feature descriptions * '' 'gross value (BWS)' ''
  GVA per economic sector is calculated by dividing the value of all goods and services produced are consumed in the production inputs (raw materials and supplies, rents and leases, costs of processing performed by other companies contract work, etc.) are deducted. The evaluation of the BWS is done at basic prices. This evaluation concept means that the subsidies granted to the production or sale of goods and services are included, but not to the goods and services produced payable taxes (VAT, import taxes, petroleum and tobacco, etc.). GVA can be specified for the circles only at current prices, as in the here considered regional depth no reliable aggregate price indices available to deflate the value sizes.
  * '' 'Economic Technical Breakdown by economic sectors and areas' ''
  done The sectoral breakdown of GVA is currently based on the Classification of Economic Activities, 2008 edition (WZ 2008).
  === Regional characteristics === * Because "accounts of the countries of Economics" the data are published regularly area adjusted by the Working Group, may due to the formation of Hannover (2001) Region, the Aachen region (2009) and the regional reforms in Saxony-Anhalt ( 2007), Saxony (2008) and Mecklenburg-Vorpommern (display 2011) for the county level for the past each prior to that date the reporting year no values.
  === === Further information [http://www.vgrdl.de/VGRdL/|Arbeitskreis National accounts of countries]
 [Http://www.vgrdl.de/VGRdL/MethDef/brochure.pdf | Working Group National Accounts of änder - Booklet]
  [Http://www.vgrdl.de/VGRdL/MethDef/WZ2008.pdf | Overview of economic activities Breakdown]
  [Https://www.regionalstatistik.de/genesis/online?operation=s tatistikenVerzeichnis | regional database: Areas]

  GVA per economic sector is calculated by dividing the value of all goods and services produced are consumed in the production inputs (raw materials and supplies, rents and leases, costs of processing performed by other companies contract work, etc.) are deducted. The evaluation of the BWS is done at basic prices. This evaluation concept means that the subsidies granted to the production or sale of goods and services are included, but not to the goods and services produced payable taxes (VAT, import taxes, petroleum and tobacco, etc.). GVA can be specified for the circles only at current prices, as in the here considered regional depth no reliable aggregate price indices available to deflate the value sizes.
  * '' 'Economic Technical Breakdown by economic sectors and areas' ''
  done The sectoral breakdown of GVA is currently based on the Classification of Economic Activities, 2008 edition (WZ 2008).
  === Regional characteristics === * Because "Accounts of the States Economic" the data are published regularly area adjusted by the Working Group, may due to the formation of Hannover (2001) Region, the Aachen region (2009) and the regional reforms in Saxony-Anhalt ( 2007), Saxony (2008) and Mecklenburg-Vorpommern (display 2011) for the county level for the past each prior to that date the reporting year no values.

en.wiki\n==Wasserabgabe je versorgten Einwo:
wiki == release of water per person per day served in liters == === === statement indicator provides information on the average given amount of drinking water to households and small businesses each day and provided inhabitants, known colloquially as per capita consumption respectively.
  === indicator calculation === For the calculation of the indicator "water delivery per supplied inhabitant per day in liters", the annual amount of the emitted by the companies of public water supply to households and small businesses drinking water divided by the number of inhabitants supplied, divided by 365 days.
 The water consumption of households is not separated represented by small businesses, since the respective domestic water meters can record the output of the enterprises of the public water supply amount of water only as a total.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data from the survey of public water supply and population statistics.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'Public water supply' ''
  Production, distribution and delivery of water for the purpose of drinking water supply to the population and the economy with companies in the public water supply.
 * '' 'Residents' ''
 To the inhabitants of Germany all people are (German and foreign) who have their permanent residence in Germany. but not to the inhabitants include the members of foreign missions and forces.
 For the calculation of the indicator "water discharge per person per day served in liter" is the number of devices connected to the public water supply residents at 30.6. of the year used.
 The population figures are from the statistical bureaus of the federal and state governments and are based in the former West Germany until 2010 on the results of the census of 25 May 1987. In the new federal states on 3 October 1990 established official population is the foundation. From the reference year 2013, the results are presented on the basis of the performed 9 May 2011 census.
 === === Regional characteristics As a result of the formation of the Hannover Region (2001) and the cities of Aachen (2009), no values ​​are displayed for the county level for the particular ahead of that date reporting years. As a result of local government reform in Saxony (2008), no values ​​can be displayed for the county level for the year of 2007.
  === === Further information [https://www.destatis.de/DE/Methoden/Qualitaet/Qualitaetsber eights / population / population projection-2017.pdf | population projection]

wiki == Proportion of births attended in full day care children aged from 0 to 2 years on the children of the same age == === === statement This indicator points to the scope of use of the full-time care of infants under 3 years.
  === indicator calculation === For the calculation of the indicator "Proportion of births attended in full day care children aged from 0 to 2 years on the children of the same age" is the number of 15 at March in child care centers and publicly funded day care children cared for in divided age from 0 to 2 years with contracted care of more than 7 hours per day by the number of inhabitants of the same age at 31 December of the previous year and multiplied by 100. Children attend both a day care center are as well served by publicly funded family day care persons are counted only once for this indicator.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data from the statistics of child round youth services as well as from the population statistics.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'all-day care' ''
  From an all-day care can be spoken when the child is looked after more than seven hours a day in a day care center or in day care.
  * '' 'Day care' ''
  As a child day care publicly organized and financed form of child care is called. It belongs to the child and youth services. Its legal basis, it takes place in the Children and Youth Welfare Act. Child day care includes education, training and care of children in day care centers and in publicly funded day care.
  * '' 'Day care center' ''
  Day care centers for children are institutions where children are full-time recorded or for part of the day as well as educational and nursing care that have full- or part-time staff, and for which an operating license according to § 45 SGB VIII or equivalent authorization.
  * '' 'Day care' ''
  The publicly funded family day care is the temporary care of children at a subsidized by the youth welfare offices childminder (day mother or father day). The publicly funded family day care is in addition to the day-care in child care centers an equivalent form of child day care. Private day care arrangements are not included in this indicator.
  * '' 'Residents' ''
  To the inhabitants of Germany all people are (German and foreign) who have their permanent residence in Germany. but not to the inhabitants include the members of foreign missions and forces. For the calculation of the indicator "Proportion of births attended in full day care children aged from 0 to 2 years on the children of the same age in percent" is the number of residents aged from 0 to 2 years at 31.12. used in the previous year. The population figures are from the statistical bureaus of the federal and state governments and are based in the former West Germany on the results of the census of 25 May 1987. In the new federal states, established on 3 October 1990 official population is the foundation. As of the 2011 reporting year, the results are presented on the basis of carried out on May 9, 2011 census.
 *'''Regional particularities'''
 Lower Saxony: The merging of the districts of Göttingen and Osterode am Harz on November 1, 2016 can no values ​​are displayed for the county level for the year 2016 for the new district Göttingen.

wiki == average age of the population at 31.12. == === === The statement indicator provides information on the average age of the population in a region. The average age is increasing at low birth rates and a simultaneous increase in life expectancy.

The sum of the numbers of cases so determined for each year is then divided by the total number of people (in each case 31.12.).

en.wiki\n==Durchschnittsalter der Mutter be:
wiki == mother at birth of first child born alive Average age ==
 === === statement indicator provides information about the average age of mothers at birth of first child born alive. The longer a woman with the first child waits, the potentially shorter the life stage where they can start a family is. Is postponing the first birth at a later age a widespread phenomenon, this may or lead (at a low overall level of fertility) to accept the final number of children to a higher childlessness.

 === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator, the average age of the mothers at the birth is after birth year method (age of the difference from the year and year of birth of the nut corresponds) is calculated based on the number of live-born infants. The calculation is limited to the infants of mothers aged 15 up to and including 49 years. At birth, a result only live births are counted. The first birth mother consequently their first live born child is, even if this might was stillborn ahead.
 === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data from the "Statistics of births."
 === Feature Description === * '' 'live births' ''
 Live births are children who defeated after the divorce from the womb either the heart or pulsating umbilical cord or the natural pulmonary respiration has begun. The other children are considered stillbirths or miscarriages.

 * '' 'Age of mothers' ''
 The mother's age is the difference between the reporting year and year of birth of mother (born in method).
 === === Further Information
 [Https://www.destatis.de/DE/Methoden/Qualitaet/Qualitaetsber eights / population / geburten.pdf | Statistics of births]
 [Https://www.regionalstatistik.de/genesis/online?operation=s tatistikenVerzeichnis | Regional Database: Areas]
en.wiki\n==Eingeb\u00fcrgerte je 1 000 Ausl:
wiki == naturalized per 1 000 foreigners ==
 === === statement indicator provides information on the number of naturalizations (without naturalization abroad) measured by the number of foreigners in Germany. When interpreting the naturalization rate has noted that its calculation includes all foreign nationals and not distinction according to whether they have the legal requirements for naturalization meet (for example, minimum stay) and thus eligible for naturalization.
 === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator "naturalization rate" is divided, the number of naturalization (without Naturalisations abroad) by the number of foreigners in Germany and multiplied by 1 000th It is the number of foreigners drawn from the population projection.
 === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data from the "naturalization statistics" and "Statistics of updating the population stocks."
 === feature descriptions === * '' 'naturalization' ''
 Naturalization is the total number of persons during the year completed by German authorities at home and abroad naturalization of foreigners. At the citizenship of a foreigner or a foreigner is granted by the issue of a certificate of naturalization German citizenship. for this must be a request is made and the respect of the foreign person must meet certain requirements. Naturalizations done in the majority due to the Nationality Act (Act), but in addition also by other legal bases that govern mostly old and restitution cases. The naturalization statistics reported completed at home and abroad by German authorities in the course of the year naturalization after their previous citizenship legal basis of naturalization, length of stay in the Federal territory, gender, age, marital status and by persistent or non-persistent previous nationality. The regional proof of naturalization cases refers to the residence of the naturalized person at the time of naturalization. The acquisition of German citizenship by birth of native-born children of foreign parents (according to § 4 para. 3 of the Nationality Act) is not included in the data.
 *'''Foreigners'''
 As a foreigner, include all persons who do not have German citizenship, not German within the meaning of Art. 116 para. 1 Basic Law (GG) are. Also, stateless persons and persons with unexplained nationalities belong to this group of people.
 === === Further Information
 [Https://www.destatis.de/DE/Methoden/Qualitaet/Qualitaetsber eights / population / einbuergerungsstatistik.pdf | naturalization statistics]

wiki == percentage of votes for the CDU / CSU to the valid votes in the European elections == === === indicator calculation 'of votes for the CDU / CSU to the valid votes in total share' as a whole for the calculation of the indicator, the vote for the CDU / CSU by the valid votes in total and multiplying by 100.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data from the general European election statistics.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'voters' ''
  Are entitled to vote all Germans and all Union citizen residing or ordinarily resident in the Federal Republic of Germany, who completed on election day of 18, at least three months in the Federal Republic of Germany or in the territories of the other Member States of the European Community hold an apartment or are ordinarily resident and not disqualified from voting. In addition, pursuant to § 12 para. 2 are entitled to vote the Federal Electoral Law to the German Bundestag Germans entitled to vote. More specifically, the right to vote results from § 6 Elections Act.
  === === * Regional characteristics CSU only in Bavaria.

wiki == percentage of votes for the SPD to the valid votes in total in the European elections == === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator 'share of votes for the SPD to the valid votes in total' are the votes for the SPD all divided by the valid votes and multiplied by 100.

en.wiki\n==Stra\u00dfenverkehrsunf\u00e4lle:
wiki == road traffic accidents per 10,000 population == === === statement The indicator is a measure of the frequency of accidents on the road. However, the code has only the local population is taken into account and a high traffic or high commuter traffic affect the outcome of the disadvantage. Differences in car ownership are not considered.
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator 'road accidents per 10,000 inhabitants', the number of road accidents is divided by the number of inhabitants in the average and multiplied by 10,000.
  == Origin == statistics The indicator is based on data from the statistics of road accidents as well as to the population.
  == feature descriptions == * '' 'road accidents' ''
  Proven are those controlled by the police accidents from the reference year 1995, in which were killed or injured as a result of vehicular traffic on public roads and squares persons or material damage. Among the accidents with property damage include serious accidents involving damage to property in the narrow sense in which an offense or a misdemeanor (fine) was present, while at least one vehicle due to an accident damage will be towed from the accident site had, as well as other property damage accidents under the influence of intoxicating substances ( at least one accident participant was under the influence of intoxicating substances, and if car were involved, they were all still roadworthy). Not included are all other property damage accidents without the influence of intoxicating substances. From 1 January 1995, the accidents were established new criteria with property damage within the meaning of the Road Traffic Accident Statistics Act for the acquisition. Unlike previous years under review serves as a collection basis is no longer the height of the resulting material damage, but the determination of whether it is a criminal offense / a misdemeanor and / or at least one accident participant under the influence of alcohol / January 1, 2008 under the influence of intoxicating substances was , the motor pool of vehicles will also be included in the assessment of the accident. Therefore, a comparison with previous years is not possible.
  * '' 'Residents' ''
  To the inhabitants of Germany all people are (German and foreign) who have their permanent residence in Germany. but not to the inhabitants include the members of foreign missions and forces. For the calculation of the indicator 'road accidents per 10,000 population', the annual average number of inhabitants is used. By 2010, the average annual population is the arithmetic average of the twelve monthly averages. These are calculated in each case as the arithmetic mean from the beginning and ending of the relevant month. The average population in 2011 is the date population on 9 May 2011. From 2012, the average annual population mean the average of beginning and year end of year.
 
  == Regional characteristics == * Average annual population:
  Baden-Wuerttemberg (1995, 2000), Bavaria, Hesse, North Rhine-Westphalia, Lower Saxony, Rhineland-Palatinate, Saarland (until 1999), Saxony (until 2007) the arithmetic mean of the population at the beginning and end of the year.
  * Saxony-Anhalt (until 2006)
  As a result of the district reform on 1 July 2007 is that from 31.12 instead of the average annual population. of the year used.
  == Further information == [https://www.destatis.de/DE/Methoden/Qualitaet/Qualitaetsber eights / traffic accidents / strassenverkehrsunfaelle.pdf | road accidents]
  [Https://www.destatis.de/DE/Methoden/Qualitaet/Qualitaetsber eights / population / population projection-2017.pdf | population projection]
  [Https://www.regionalstatistik.de/genesis/online?operation=s tatistikenVerzeichnis | regional database: Areas]

  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator "proportion of the traffic area of ​​the total area of ​​31.12." the traffic area is divided by the total and multiplying by 100.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data from the "land survey by type of actual use."
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'total area (land area)' ''
  The bottom surface of a regional unit (z. B. community, unincorporated, circle) is composed of all within the specified limits of the area lying surfaces together. Cost-base for the area survey according to the actual use has been making 2016 the Official Real Estate Cadastre Information System (ALKIS). With the new cost-base of the nationwide agreed use type catalog has been modified and expanded. Before 2016, the survey was based on an evaluation of the real estate cadastre, most recently the automated real estate books (ALB). By changing the acquisition basis to compare data from 2016 is considerably limited with previous years, for methodological reasons. The survey covers all belonging to a regional unit areas, wherein the definitions and demarcations used here used with the other projections, despite z. T. identical or similar wording, not, or not fully in line.
  *''' Traffic'''
  The uses range transport includes the developed and undeveloped areas used to traffic.
 
  === === * Regional characteristics Baden-Württemberg
  including nationwide total. uninhabited, unincorporated areas Rheinau (Ortenaukreis) and Gutsbezirk Münsingen (district Reutlingen)

en.wiki\n==Anteil der Siedlungs- und Verkeh:
wiki == share of housing and transport in the total area of ​​31.12. == === === statement indicator provides information on the use of non-renewable total area of ​​an area by the use for settlement and transport purposes.
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator "share of housing and transport in the total area of ​​31.12." the sum of settlement area without "mining operation" and without "open pit mine, quarry" and transport area is divided by the total and multiplying by 100.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data from the "land survey by type of actual use."
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'total area (land area)' ''
  The bottom surface of a regional unit (z. B. community, unincorporated, circle) is composed of all within the specified limits of the area lying surfaces together. Cost-base for the area survey according to the actual use has been making 2016 the Official Real Estate Cadastre Information System (ALKIS). With the new cost-base of the nationwide agreed use type catalog has been modified and expanded. Before 2016, the survey was based on an evaluation of the real estate cadastre, most recently the automated real estate books (ALB). By changing the acquisition basis to compare data from 2016 is considerably limited with previous years, for methodological reasons. The survey covers all belonging to a regional unit areas, wherein the definitions and demarcations used here used with the other projections, despite z. T. identical or similar wording, not, or not fully in line.
  *'''Settlement'''
  The uses range settlement includes developed and undeveloped areas that are affected by the settlement of people or contribute to the settlement.
  * '' 'Mining operation' ''
  Mining operation is an area that is used for the promotion of the extracted mineral underground.
  * '' 'Open pit, mine, quarry' ''
  Open pit mine, quarry is a surface that is broken down on the overground floor material.
  *'''Traffic'''
  The uses range transport includes the developed and undeveloped areas used to traffic.
 
  === === * Regional characteristics Baden-Württemberg
  including nationwide total. uninhabited, unincorporated areas Rheinau (Ortenaukreis) and Gutsbezirk Münsingen (district Reutlingen)
  * Rhineland-Palatinate, Saarland

  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator "change of Sied-lungs- and traffic area per year" is the difference between the housing and transport at 31.12. the report-year and 31.12. Divided by the previous year, the housing and transport the previous year and multiplied by 100. For the calculation of "settlement and traffic area" is the sum of settlement areas without mining operation and without open pit, mine, quarry and road surface is formed.

en.wiki\n==Erwerbst\u00e4tige insgesamt (am:
wiki == total employment (place of work) per 1,000 people of working age between 15 and 64 years, annual average (job density) == === statement === The indicator provides information on the relative labor supply of the population of working age. A high job density suggests good employment opportunities of the population. In cities the job density i. d. R. higher than in the countryside. Part of the urban labor demand is usually covered there by commuters from surrounding regions.
  === indicator calculation === For the calculation of the indicator "Total employment (place of work) per 1,000 people of working age between 15 and 64 years," so the job density is the number of total employment (place of work) by the number of residents divided the working age between 15 and 64 years and multiplied by 1,000.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data on employment of the working group "employment accounts of the federal and state governments" (calculated as of August 2015) and to the population.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'gainfully employed' ''
  The representation of the work is carried out as an annual average size according to the domestic concept (employed at the work site). of residents outside of this area people that reach as commuters in this region whose place of employment is recognized, therefore, all persons who have their residence and work in the area concerned, plus. To the labor force include all persons exercising any operation designed to employment, regardless of the length of the actual payments or contractually payable work hours. For the assignment than the employed, it is irrelevant whether the majority livelihood is denied from this activity or not. In case of multiple activities the worker is counted only once (persons concept). Here are some of the workers all persons as employees in an employment relationship are (workers, employees, civil servants, soldiers and trainees, marginal employees - workers primarily "only low-paid workers" (400-euro jobs), "slightly in the short term "and" employees in job opportunities "(so-called. 1-euro jobs)) as well as home workers or self-employed (incl. their family workers) who operate a business or a farm or practice a profession. Not count as employed persons as administrators of their private assets (eg. As real estate, financial assets, securities). Based on this definition form established by the International Labor Organization (ILO) standards of Accounts in the European System of Accounts (ESA) received the 1,995th
  * '' 'Residents' ''
  To the inhabitants of Germany all people are (German and foreign) who have their permanent residence in Germany. but not to the inhabitants include the members of foreign missions and forces. For the calculation of the indicator Total employment (place of work) per 1,000 people of working age between 15 and 64 years, an annual average, the number of residents aged 15 to 64 at 31.12. of the year used. If this is not yet available for the last reporting period, the population of the previous year is used. The population figures are from the statistical bureaus of the federal and state governments.
  === Regional characteristics === Since the data are published regularly area adjusted by the Working Group employment accounts of the federal and state governments, can due to the formation of the Hannover Region (2001), the Aachen region (2009) and the regional reforms in Saxony-Anhalt (2007 , Saxony (2008) and Mecklenburg-Vorpommern (display 2011) for the county level for the particular ahead of that date reporting year no values).
  === === Further information [http: //www.ak-etr.de | employed persons]

en.wiki\n==Verbrauchsabh\u00e4ngiges Entgel:
wiki == consumption related charge for drinking water supply of households per cubic meter == === statement === The indicator provides information on the payment performance of private households for related by the companies of public water supply drinking water in euros per cubic meter, commonly referred to as water price ,
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator "Consumption related charge for drinking water supply of households per cubic meter" is weighted the action brought by the companies in the public water supply fee at the community level with the respective (connected) population. Above the municipality level, the average charge is determined as a weighted average based on the population as a whole.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data from the survey of water and wastewater charges and demographic statistics.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'consumption-dependent payment for the supply of drinking water per cubic meter' ''
  In the consumption price are all part charges for final users such as Water withdrawal money investment contribution and other usage-based charges included. In cases where each municipality several companies are working with different usage-based fees, a weighted average fee is calculated at the community level. The fees are weighted by the number of connected inhabitants. Above the municipality level, the average charge is determined as a weighted average based on the population as a whole. The weighting in general all residents to be involved, that is the citizens who pay no usage-based fee. There are gross figures.
 === Regional characteristics === Since the collection of water and wastewater charges is 3-annually at the uniform area of ​​jurisdiction for three reporting years can due to the formation of the cities Aachen (2009), and territorial reform in Mecklenburg-Vorpommern (2011) for the county level for the reference years are 2008 to 2010, no values ​​display. Due to different calculation methods with different results compared to the state-owned publications no values ​​are displayed for Saxony-Anhalt for the county level for the report in 2008 by 2010.
  === === Further information [https://www.destatis.de/DE/Methoden/Qualitaet/Qualitaetsber eights / Environment / survey-water-abwasserentgelte.pdf | water and wastewater charges]
  [Https://www.destatis.de/DE/Methoden/Qualitaet/Qualitaetsber eights / Environment / public water supply-sewage disposal .pdf | Public water supply]
  [Https://www.regionalstatistik.de/genesis/online?operation=s tatistikenVerzeichnis | regional database: Areas]
en.wiki\n==Haushalts\u00fcbliches verbrauch:
wiki == household Usual consumption independent charge for the drinking water supply of private households per year == === statement === The indicator is independent of the consumption information on the normal domestic payment power of private households for the provision of drinking water by the companies of the public water supply (basic pay, base Price).
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator "household consumption Usual independent fee for the drinking water supply of private households per year," the charge imposed by the companies of public water supply is weighted at the community level with the respective (connected) population. Above the municipality level, the average charge is determined as a weighted average based on the population as a whole.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data from the survey of water and wastewater charges and demographic statistics.
  === feature descriptions === * '' 'consumption independent charge for the supply of drinking water per year' ''
  Households pay a consumption-related fee in Euros per cubic meter for the specific drinking water ( "water price") and a consumption independent charge in euros per year for the contents provided by the companies utilities and use of home water meter to the business of public water supply in general ( "base Price"). Normal domestic consumption independent charge refers to the standard household meter size or annual consumption class.
 In cases where each municipality several companies are operating with different fuel-independent charges, a weighted average fee is calculated at the community level, respectively. The fees are weighted by the number of connected inhabitants. Above the municipality level, the average charge is determined as a weighted average based on the population as a whole. The weighting in general all residents are included, d. H. the citizens who pay no consumption-dependent and consumption-independent remuneration. There are gross figures.
 === Regional characteristics === Since the collection of water and wastewater charges is 3-annually at the uniform area of ​​jurisdiction for three reporting years can due to the formation of the cities Aachen (2009), and territorial reform in Mecklenburg-Vorpommern (2011) for the county level for the reference years are 2008 to 2010, no values ​​display. Due to different calculation methods with different results compared to the state-owned publications no values ​​are displayed for Saxony-Anhalt for the county level for the report in 2008 by 2010.
  === === Further information [https://www.destatis.de/DE/Methoden/Qualitaet/Qualitaetsber eights / Environment / survey-water-abwasserentgelte.pdf | water and wastewater charges]
  [Https://www.destatis.de/DE/Methoden/Qualitaet/Qualitaetsber eights / Environment / public water supply-sewage disposal .pdf | Public water supply]

en.wiki\n==Pkw-Bestand je 1.000 Einwohner a:
wiki == car ownership per 1,000 inhabitants 01.01. == === === statement indicator provides information for car trim the population. The car density is generally higher in rural areas than in urban areas. The traffic load by Durchgangsund Einpendelverkehr is disregarded.
  === === indicator calculation for the calculation of the indicator "car ownership per 1,000 inhabitants" is the number of car ownership 01.01. by the number of inhabitants at 31.12. of the previous year is divided and multiplied by 1,000.
  === === origin statistics The indicator is based on data from the official motor vehicle statistics of the Federal Motor Vehicle Office for passenger cars on hand and the statistical offices of the federal and state governments to the population.
  === === feature descriptions
  * '' 'Motor vehicle component' ''
  Which permitted number of vehicles at the time of counting at a specified date (January 1 of each year) with a registration plate for traffic (up to 01.01.2007 including temporarily deregistered vehicles) and in the Central Vehicle Register (ZFZR) of the Federal Motor Vehicle Office (KBA) are stored. Included also vehicles perform an insurance plate, as well as vehicles of the Federal Police and the Technical Relief (THW). are against not include the vehicles of the Bundeswehr as well as vehicles with red or temporary license plate and export license plates. The data on the number of motor vehicles are provided by the Federal Motor Transport Authority in Flensburg.
  * '' 'Cars' ''
  Power passenger vehicles with at least four wheels and with more than eight seats excluding the driver. Caravans, ambulances, hearses and bullet-proof vehicles did not count on passenger cars to 30 September, 2005. With the EU-wide harmonization of these vehicles are assigned to special purpose from 1 October 2005 to passenger cars.
  * '' 'Residents' ''
  To the inhabitants of Germany all people are (German and foreign) who have their permanent residence in Germany. but not to the inhabitants include the members of foreign missions and forces. For the calculation of the indicator "car ownership per 1,000 inhabitants" is the number of inhabitants to 31.12. of the reference date of the car fleet (January 1 of each year) used the previous year. The population figures are from the statistical bureaus of the federal and state governments and are based in the former West Germany until 2010 on the results of the census of 25 May 1987. In the new federal states on 3 October 1990 established official population is the foundation. As of the 2011 reporting year, the results are presented on the basis of carried out on May 9, 2011 census.
 
  === === Regional characteristics Germany (until 1999): Incl. Vehicles with BP marks that are no longer reported separately. Lower Saxony, North Rhine-Westphalia, Rhineland-Palatinate, Bavaria, Brandenburg, Saxony and Saxony-Anhalt (2006). Total country including vehicles that could not be allocated regionally. Thuringia (1996): Results of the independent city of Eisenach are included in Wartburgkreis. Mecklenburg-Vorpommern: As a result of local government reform in 2011 can no values ​​are displayed for the county level for the year 2011th Lower Saxony: The merging of the districts of Göttingen and Osterode am Harz on November 1, 2016 can no values ​​are displayed for the county level for the year 2016 for the new district Göttingen.
  === === Further Information

  This includes full-time and part-time employees at offices and facilities (including the legally dependent companies as well as hospitals with commercial accounting) of the municipalities and municipal associations.
 Employees are (workers) prepared according to the respective service location (Officials) or work of the main and extension of a service center.

en.Einb\u00fcrgerungen von Ausl\u00e4ndern\:
Naturalization of Foreigners
 
  Explanation for the following statistics (s): 12511 naturalization statistics
  Connotation: Naturalization
 Naturalization is the total number of persons during the year completed by German authorities at home and abroad naturalization of foreigners. At the citizenship of a foreigner or a foreigner is granted by the issue of a certificate of naturalization German citizenship. for this must be a request is made and the respect of the foreign person must meet certain requirements. Naturalizations done in the majority due to the nationality keitsgesetzes (Act), but in addition also by other legal bases, which usually govern Altund restitution cases. The naturalization statistics reported completed at home and abroad by German authorities in the course of the year naturalization after their previous citizenship legal grounds of naturalization, length of stay in the Federal territory, gender, age, marital status and previous to persistent or non-persistent nationality. The regional proof of naturalization cases refers to the residence of the naturalized person at the time of naturalization. The acquisition of German citizenship by birth of native-born children of foreign parents (according to § 4 para. 3 of the Nationality Act) is not holding corresponds to the data.
 Connotation: Aliens
 As a foreigner, include all persons who do not have German citizenship, not German within the meaning of Art. 116 para. 1 Basic Law (GG) are. Also, stateless persons and persons with unexplained nationalities belong to this group of people.

 Under a residential spaces are to be understood outside completed, specific for residential purposes, together lying in the rule that allow the leadership of an autonomous budget. One apartment has basically its own lockable access directly from the outside, from the staircase or from an anteroom, further water supply, sink and toilet. en.Erwerbspersonen\n \n \nErl\u00e4uterung:
labor force
 
  Explanation for the following statistics (s): 12111 Census - Population
  Connotation: employment status
  The basis for this feature is the labor force concept of the International Labor Organization (ILO). A distinction is made between "labor" and "inactive". The "labor force" are divided into "gainfully employed" and "unemployed".
  Employment according to the ILO definition, any person of working age from 15 years, (9 to 15 May 2011) in a one-week period at least one hour worked long on a fee or as part of a self-employed or a family worker. Even someone who is in a formal working relationship that he has only temporarily absent during the reporting period, considered employed.
  As unemployed within the meaning of concretised by the EU ILO definition each person in the reporting period (9 to 15 May 2011) was not working, but in the last four weeks before the survey is actively seeking a true working age over 15, activity sought. The temporal extent of the work sought is irrelevant. A new work has to be taken within two weeks. The inclusion of an employment agency or a local carrier in the search effort is required.
  Persons who are neither employed nor unemployed, are considered inactive.

Control power authorized under SGB II
 
  Explanation for the following statistics (s): 22811 Social Reporting
  Connotation: control power authorized under SGB II
  Control power are authorized person is entitled to the total control performance (unemployment benefits II or social money). These include persons who are entitled to the following types of benefits:
 - control demand unemployment benefits or social allowance (§§ 20, 23 SGB II)
 - additional requirements (§ 21 SGB II)
 - ongoing and recurring benefits for accommodation and Hei-cutting costs, including payment of arrears of heating and operating and Heizmittelbevorratung, Wohnbeschaffungs- costs, rent arrears and maintenance and repair costs for owner-occupied property (§ 22 SGB II) and
 - efristeter surcharge after the receipt of unemployment benefit (§ 24 SGB II A. F., accounts from 1 January 2011).
 Total regular benefit (unemployment benefit II and social benefit) includes the standard need to secure the livelihood services for additional needs, cost of accommodation, and until 31.12.2010 a temporary supplement following receipt of unemployment benefits pursuant to § 24 SGB II (old version). The total control power is made up of unemployment benefits for employable beneficiaries and social welfare benefits for non-working-age beneficiaries together.

en.Bruttoeinnahmen der Gemeinden\n \n \nErl:
Gross revenue of communities
 
  Explanation for the following statistics (s): 71517/4 Annual cash results, sector communities
  Connotation: Gross revenue of communities
  Gross income shall come from the cash terms revenues of the administrative and financial budget of municipalities and associations of municipalities, but not the circle, adjusted for:
 
  - Cultivated foreign agents (e.g., housing benefit, maintenance advance.), - the business tax assessment, - the budgetary Allocations (inner allocations imputed costs, interest income from inner loan, additions of administration or assets household).
  This table lists the special financing transactions, however, are not sold in the interests of the fullest possible description of the actual financial situation of each community.
  In this table "Total" positions (columns 1, 2 and 4) multiple entries are included due to the unweaned official or association assessment in the.
  In countries with municipal groupings below the circuit plane (offices, Verbandsgemeinden, Samtgemeinden, administration Communities), the individual communities for regional comparisons are less suitable due to the transition of tasks and financial resources to this intermediate. The finances of the two lowest tiers of government are therefore summarized in these cases.
  The administrative budget is made up of taxes and tax-like revenue, general grants and contributions, income from management and operation as well as other financial income. Not included in the administrative budget for transitory funds, budgetary allocations and graduation technical operations. Further, the business tax assessment is issued (net representation of the control).
  Revenues from taxes are the revenue under the tax laws. Similar tax revenues are the revenues from parafiscal as undistributed hunting lease revenue. Revenue from administrative and operational include the revenues from public service charges for the use of administrative services in the strict sense (management fees) and for the charges for the use of public facilities or the use of economic services and revenue from dedicated taxes (. B. spa tax).
  The capital budget consists of the withdrawals from reserves, loan repayments, the proceeds from the sale of movable property and land, the production of security and similar charges, investment allocations, the borrowings and internal loans. the leads from the administrative budget and graduation technical processes (IST-excess of the financial budget) are not included in capital budget.

en.Bruttoausgaben der Kreise\n \n \nErl\u00:
Gross expenditure of the circles
 
  Explanation for the following statistics (s): 71517/4 Annual cash results, sector communities
  Connotation: gross expenditure of the circles - without county-StädteDie gross expenditure to the administrative and financial budget put together from the cash terms editions of the county governments, (ie not the sum of municipal budgets..) Adjusted to:
  - Farmed borrowed funds - the budgetary allocations (internal allocations, imputed costs, interest expenditure on internal loans, transfers to administrative and capital budget).
  This table lists the special financing transactions, however, are not sold in the interests of the fullest possible description of the actual financial situation of each circle.

  Explanation for the following statistics (s): 82111 national accounts of the countries - production approach
  Connotation: Gross Domestic Product (GDP) / gross value added (GVA)
  GDP and GVA is a measure of the service provided in a region's economic performance. GVA per economic sector is calculated by dividing the value of all goods and services produced are consumed in the production inputs (raw materials and supplies, rents and leases, costs of processing performed by other companies contract work, etc.) are deducted. The evaluation of the BWS is done at basic prices. This evaluation concept means that the subsidies granted to the production or sale of goods and services are included, but not to the goods and services produced payable taxes (VAT, import taxes, petroleum and tobacco, etc.).
 GDP is valued at market prices. It is calculated by adding added to the total GVA at basic prices of the circles lump sum distributed net of taxes-subsidies. The financial service indirect measurement (FISIM) is already implicitly included in the economic sectors.
 GDP and GVA can be specified for the circles only at current prices, as in the here considered regional depth no reliable aggregate price indices available to deflate the value sizes.

  Explanation for the following statistics (s): 22541 Statistics of children and persons who work in day care centers
  Connotation: day care centers for children
  These are facilities where children are taken throughout the day or for part of the day as well as educational and nursing care that have full- or part-time staff and there or a similar authorization for an operating license according to § 45 SGB VIII. For the day-care facilities for children is distinguished according to types of devices, with the discrimination by reference to whether are cared for in the establishment only children of certain ages in so-called "old homogeneous" groups or whether it is a closer to characterizing mixed form.
 A facility for children aged under 3 years are when children are cared for exclusively under the age of 3 years in this facility in one or more groups.
 A facility for children aged 2 to under 8 years - without school children - is, are cared for in in one or more groups only children aged 2 years to school age means.
 A facility for children aged 5 to under 14 years old - only school children - is a facility in which the available places are for school children.
 The institutions with children of all ages is to be
 a) days old devices with uniform groups Here children are cared for different age classes in different age groups homogeneous parallel.
 b) day-care centers with mixed-age groups in these institutions are children of different old-age classes, that is, Children in the nursery age, kindergarten age and / or nursery age cared for together the groups in altersübergreifen-.
 c) day-care centers with old uniform and age-mixed groups are Here both old cross and altershomo- gene groups are present.
 The classification of the types of institutions is solely dependent on the age of children cared for at the reporting date. It does not matter what kind of device is, according. Approval or similar arrangements.

total sales
 
  Explanation for the following statistics (s): 53111 crafts census
  Connotation: Sales
  In the business register proven sales (excluding VAT) include the taxable goods and services of the company. Information on companies with taxable turnover from goods and services to be sent by the tax authorities together with the information on the sales tax statistics annually to the statistical offices of the federal and state governments. In the data supplied material of the tax authorities all VAT registered businesses are included, which have submitted in the respective reporting year VAT returns in Germany and was an annual turnover in the reporting period more than 17 500 euros.
 Taxable transactions of each craft enterprises include not only the craft sales, but also sales of non-craft activities. For example, run car dealerships usually a vehicle workshop and are therefore registered in the trades. These companies also generate revenues through sales of new and used cars. A breakdown of taxable transactions according to specific criteria in craft sales and other revenue is not possible. The non-artisanal sales are therefore included in the proven sales of craft enterprises.
 In the business register sales estimates are made for individual values ​​when the companies are part of a tax fiscal unity. In a fiscal unity only of the dominating reports (parent and subsidiary companies) external sales of the affiliation to the regional tax offices for tax group members. There are no data on which revenues achieved by each tax group members. Therefore, the turnover of each tax group members is estimated on the basis of the reported to the tax authorities turnover of the entire tax group and other features on individual data level.
 Estimated sales of organ shaft members are included in the column 6 and are taken into account in column 7 in the calculation.
 In the tables of the craft count ( "Interpretation limited because the numerical value is statistically relatively uncertain" d. E.) Are sales results based on more than 30% on an estimate by brackets indicated. From an estimated 40% do not have corresponding results are made because the respective numerical value then is not secure enough. These positions are locked with "/".
 Since accounted for using the craft Statistics Act only independent craft businesses in the crafts census, are revenues from craft activity that is not crafted in artisan incidental activities or internal departments companies are generated, not included in the proven sales.

  Explanation for the following statistics (s): 82411 national accounts of the countries - redistribution bill

  Disposable income is to be understood as the amount that is available to households for consumption purposes or savings available. This results in that the primary income monetary benefits (pensions, unemployment benefits, child support, etc.) and other current transfers are added and the social contributions and other current transfers and income taxes and other taxes that are to be made by households, subtracted from. The primary household income includes earned income and assets, accrued to the domestic private households (z. B. Self-employed income, compensation of employees).

en.Unf\u00e4lle (ingesamt)\n \n \nErl\u00e4:
Accidents (total)
 
  Explanation for the following statistics (s): 46241 Statistics of road accidents
  Connotation: road accidents
  Proven are those controlled by the police accidents from the reference year 1995, in which were killed or injured as a result of vehicular traffic on public roads and squares persons or material damage. Among the accidents with property damage include serious accidents involving damage to property in the narrow sense in which an offense or a misdemeanor (fine) was present, while at least one vehicle due to an accident damage will be towed from the accident site had, as well as other property damage accidents under the influence of intoxicating substances ( at least one accident participant was under the influence of intoxicating substances, and if car were involved, they were all still roadworthy).
 Not included are all other property damage accidents without the influence of intoxicating substances.
 From 1 January 1995, the accidents were established new criteria with property damage within the meaning of the Road Traffic Accident Statistics Act for the acquisition. Unlike previous years under review serves as a collection basis is no longer the height of the resulting material damage, but the determination of whether it is a criminal offense / a misdemeanor and / or at least one accident participant under the influence of alcohol / January 1, 2008 under the influence of intoxicating substances was , the motor pool of vehicles will also be included in the assessment of the accident. Therefore, a comparison with previous years is not possible.

"Serious accidents involving damage to property in the strict sense" are accidents in which a criminal offense or a misdemeanor (fine) was present, while at least one vehicle due to an accident damage will be towed from the accident site had (this also includes cases under the influence of intoxicating substances).
 "Other accidents under the influence of intoxicating agents" are accidents in which all car involved were still roadworthy and at the same time was at least one accident participant under the influence of intoxicating substances.
 This excludes all other property damage accidents without the influence of intoxicating substances.
